article.caption: Tulisa is dragged into sex vid storm
X Factor Tulisa is so Skin love
Tulisa Contostavlos beds TOWIE hunk Mark Wright

articles.articlebody:
SIMON Cowell last night stood by Tulisa Contostavlos over her sex tape scandal  and said she would remain an X Factor judge.

The TV guru spoke out after 23-year-old N-Dubz star Tulisa admitted she WAS the girl in a smutty video that was touted online.

Furious Simon blasted the "scumbag" who leaked the erotic video.

The telly mogul declared the row would have no impact on the star's talent show job and revealed he hit the roof after hearing the home-made film was for sale on the net.

He said the person who leaked it had "sold what was something private"  and insisted: "What she was doing was not illegal.

"You are allowed to do this stuff in your bedroom, but you don't want the tape to come out."

Simon, 52, also said he had not seen the film  but joked: "I am going to watch it tonight."

Turning to the person behind the online leak, he added: "Whoever he is, he's a scumbag  and I'm being really conservative with my words here.

"It's disgusting, repulsive. He's embarrassed her and he's got no right to put her in this position.

"He should literally find a hole and hide in it for the next week. It really, really annoys me. It's like, 'Who do you think you are?'"

Stressing his support for N-Dubz singer Tulisa, Simon went on: "It makes no difference with me about her coming back on the show  100 per cent.

"I mean, God, if I said no (to her coming back) it's allowing every sleazebag in the country to wreck somebody's career when she didn't do something wrong.

"The public are very, very a) forgiving, and b) understanding. But I hope they don't forgive the person who did it."

Simon said all four of last year's X Factor judges  Tulisa, Gary Barlow, Louis Walsh and Kelly Rowland  were set to return. The Sun has already revealed that Gary will be back.

Despite Simon's backing, the leaked video scandal showed no signs of easing up last night.

The man Tulisa says appears in the video  Justin Edwards  has made a series of claims about the origin of the six-minute film.

The Sun can reveal that he told the X Factor judge's lawyers last October that he didn't have a copy of it.

Tulisa, who is said to be "completely devastated" by the leak, set the law firm on Edwards  known as MC Ultra  after apparently learning about the online leaks.

In response, he stated that he had "no knowledge whatsoever of any tape" and didn't have "a tape such as you referred to at all".

He added in his response to the lawyers: "Even if I did which I do not, I would have no desire to publish them, simply because I would find that ungentlemanly. I was brought up better than that."

Rapper Edwards made the denial just weeks after an unknown man showed The Sun images of a woman performing a sex act. He claimed the woman was Tulisa.

Yesterday, after Tulisa claimed in a YouTube video that HE had leaked the camera-phone footage, Edwards said on Twitter: "To find the truth both sides of the story should be heard."

Tulisa had initially denied she was in the video. But after a website this week started charging for downloads, her lawyers raced to London's High Court to have it taken offline.

And on Wednesday night Tulisa admitted she WAS the woman in the film.

The singer  poised to launch a solo career  said on YouTube: "When you share an intimate moment with someone you love, you never imagine that at any point it will be shared with people around the world.

"It's a pretty tough time for me, but I don't feel I should take the heat for it."

c.robertson@the-sun.co.uk
articles.byline: By COLIN ROBERTSON, TV Editor, and GARY O’SHEA
articles.teaser: MUSIC guru Simon Cowell stands by Tulisa Contostavlos over her sex tape scandal
articles.headline: Cowell: Sex tape Tulisa hasn't blown her job

First image of bath tub where Whitney died

articles.articlebody:
WHITNEY Houston's death was triggered by cocaine, a coroner's report revealed last night.

An autopsy on the singer, 48, found the cause of death was drowning due to heart disease and cocaine use.

The Los Angeles coroner revealed the superstar singer, 48, took a line "immediately" before she drowned in a Beverly Hills hotel bathtub last month.

Toxicology results indicated "chronic use" of cocaine over time had contributed to the heart disease. It is believed the Bodyguard star suffered a heart attack before slipping under the water and drowning.

Relatives were said to be devastated at hearing cocaine was to blame.

Whitney's family said in a statement: "We are saddened to learn of the toxicology results, although we are glad to now have closure."

Her mum Cissy, 79, and daughter Bobbi Kristina, 19, have been struggling to cope since the tragedy.

Coroner's spokesman Craig Harvey confirmed Whitney appeared to have used cocaine "in the time period immediately prior to her collapse in the bathtub".

A report from the coroner's office stated: "How injury occurred: Found submerged in a bathtub filled with water; cocaine intake."

It said Whitney also had marijuana, Benadryl, Xanax and other medication in her system, but those drugs were NOT a factor.

Investigators had said they found no evidence of illegal drugs at the scene, although officials confirmed prescription pill bottles were found.

American showbiz site TMZ reported sources that claimed a mystery individual removed any traces of cocaine from Whitney's hotel room.

They also alleged that the person who cleaned up the drugs had supplied them to the singer.

It added that Beverly Hills Police have confirmed their investigation into Whitney's death had not yet been finished.

But the site said cops would not comment on whether they were looking at any allegations of evidence tampering

The coroner's report said her death was an accident, and added: "No trauma or foul play is suspected."

The coroner's office said results indicated Whitney also suffered from heart disease that caused 60 per cent narrowing of her arteries.

Assistant Chief Coroner Ed Winter said the condition is common in cocaine users.

He said: "It just beats up their heart and they will have a heart attack."

A final, more detailed, coroner's report will be released in two weeks.

Whitney battled addiction to crack cocaine at the height of her fame. Some blamed her stormy 14-year marriage to Bobby Brown.

p.samson@the-sun.co.uk
articles.teaser: STAR died of accidental drowning due to the effects of cocaine use and heart disease, coroner says
articles.headline: Coroner: Cocaine killed Whitney
articles.subdeck: Tragic ... Whitney Houston on night out just two days before her death

image.caption: Knapp-smack ... Onur Gemikli shows his damaged BMW

article.caption: Harry: I feared the worst
Harry: Spurs are playing well
Harry wants bottle

articles.articlebody:
A SHOCKED driver told last night how his BMW was wrecked  in a crash with Harry Redknapp.

Newsagent Onur Gemikli, 22, was at the wheel of his swish 3 Series soft-top when it was rear-ended by a two-ton Range Rover.

He climbed out to swap details and spent several minutes chatting with the driver before realising it was the Spurs manager.

Harry, 65  widely tipped to take over as England boss  was on his way home after watching his Tottenham side's 1-1 home draw with Stoke.

Onur, who supports Turkish team Galatasaray, hit his brakes as a car swerved in front of him in Enfield, North London, but was hit from behind.

He said: "I was furious. I ran to the car that cut me up, but it sped off. I was in shock and pain as my head had hit the head-rest, then the Range Rover driver asked, 'Are you OK?' and told me not to worry.

"It was only when he wrote his name down that I realised it was Harry.

"He was a true gentleman about it, really nice, put me at ease and told me to ring him next day.

"My car's a write-off, but not everyone can say their motor was wrecked in a crash with Harry Redknapp." The soccer boss did not comment.

n.syson@the-sun.co.uk
articles.teaser: SHOCKED driver tells how his car was wrecked  in a crash with the Spurs boss
articles.headline: Spurs' Harry in BMW shunt

image.caption: Under attack ... dog grabs arm of officer in vice-like grip

video.caption: SEE horrific attack as dog clamps jaws onto officer's arm during police raid

article.caption: Boy, 8, 'savaged by Japanese fight dog'
World's ugliest dog dies

articles.articlebody:
THESE were the amazing scenes yesterday as a devil dog savaged FIVE cops when the arrest of a kidnap suspect went horribly wrong.

The animal, named Poison and thought to be a pitbull terrier-doberman cross, went berserk after officers smashed down the front door of a family living near the Olympic Games site.

One screaming cop whose leg was mauled to the bone had to leap on a car to escape the snarling dog.

He was among three taken to hospital with serious injuries. Two needed skin grafts for hand, arm and leg wounds. The powerful hound's other two victims were described as "walking wounded". Marksmen and cops with riot shields were called in  and Poison was killed with four shots.

It later emerged it was known to neighbours as a menace.

Council officials dealing with dangerous dogs were alerted last year after it tore chunks off a cyclist.

The house was visited but there was no response. No action was taken. Yesterday's drama erupted in Stratford, East London  in Albert Square, namesake of the setting of TV's EastEnders. Cops smashed the door with a ram to seize a man wanted for kidnap and GBH. But the dog went for them, sending them scattering.

Neighbour Dennis Clarke, 72, said: "It had one around the back of his leg, right down to the bone. He was screaming and yelling for help."

Some cops raced along the street, telling locals to stay inside. Others tried to beat the dog with poles.

A man of 25, suspected to be the dog's owner, was arrested. He was also quizzed about the original alleged offences. Two injured cops were later discharged from hospital.

The suspect was among 1,065 held in a two-day police blitz across the capital. It rounded up people wanted for questioning or who had failed to attend court.

Musician Pierre Robinson, 25, was charged under the Dangerous Dogs Act today after five officers were mauled during a raid.

Robinson will appear in court today accused of "allowing the dog to be dangerously out of control" outside his home in Albert Square, east London.

Three officers remain in hospital after being savaged by the "pitbull-type" animal. One may need skin grafts after the attack yesterday.

n.syson@ the-sun.co.uk
articles.teaser: AMAZING scenes as devil dog, named Poison, went berserk causing serious injuries
articles.headline: Five cops savaged by pitbull
articles.subdeck: Under attack ... dog grabs arm of officer in vice-like grip

image.caption: Filth ... pig found in council home

article.caption: About that 'micro pig' you sold me...
Micro pigs celebrate Xmas in sty-le

articles.articlebody:
A MAN has been evicted from his home after literally letting it become a PIG STY.

The council house in Derby was left to rack and ruin - with a Gloucester Old Spot pig found roaming free inside.

Carpets throughout the ground level of the two-up two-down home were soiled with faeces and muck - including the kitchen and toilet.

The unnamed owner - believed to be an "excessive hoarder" - was also keeping two Shetland ponies in the garden and a dog living alongside the pig in filthy conditions.

Fed up residents made a number of complaints after reporting they thought the pig had been kept cooped up inside for over a year.

While others reported a strong smell of urine whenever the weather was warm.

One resident living on Kingsley Street said: "He used to chuck stuff outside in the middle of the night and once I saw laminate flooring soaked in poo and urine piled up outside the home."

Another noted: "I saw the man with the pig when it was tiny and he just had it in his hands outside the front of his home.

"I thought it was one of those micro-pigs which wouldn't grow - but obviously it wasn't and he just kept it cooped up in there for over a year."

Derby Homes, which manages the council house, said the "excessive hoarder" had filled rooms with so much junk that they could not get in at all.

Maria Murphy, director of housing and customer service, said it would cost between £10,000 and £15,000 to clear the damaged home.

She added: "This is a disgraceful waste of money, caused by a tenant who failed to show respect for this property or his tenancy agreement."

Derby Homes had been trying to get access to the property since September last year when the first complaint was made of a pony being kept in the rear garden and a pig being inside.

Although RSPCA and housing staff went out, the tenant would not allow them access.

And after the RSPCA paid him a surprise visit two months later they spotted two ponies in the garden.

A court order then told the tenant to allow access to housing staff but he failed to comply.

The court, therefore, granted an eviction notice and staff swooped on March 15.

Mrs Murphy said the tenant arrived at his home as staff were gaining entry and took away the dog and pig.
articles.teaser: A MAN has been evicted from his home after literally letting it become a PIG STY.
articles.headline: Snout nice about this house - it's a pig sty
articles.subdeck: Filth ... pig found in council home

image.caption: Tragic victims ... Holly Wells,left, and Jessica Chapman
This picture of my Holly no longer haunts me - Dad of murdered Soham schoolgirl: I imagine her grown up

articles.articlebody:
MURDERED Soham schoolgirl Holly Wells' dad says the picture of her in her football shirt "no longer impacts" on him because he now imagines her as a grown woman.

The image was taken hours before she and Jessica Chapman were killed by Ian Huntley and was used in appeals for the pair's whereabouts.

It shows Holly and Jessica smiling happily in Manchester United shirts at a family barbeque.

In a rare interview Holly's dad Kevin said he now imagined his daughter as a grown woman.

Mr Wells, 48, said: "She would have been 21 this year. She was 10 when she was killed, but she would have been 11 a few weeks later.

"That photo no longer impacts on me. We released it to the police during the 13-day search, because it was a very up-to-date one, the last photo of the girls.

"I don't want to talk about what it has been like the past 10 years, not now."

Holly and Jessica were murdered by Huntley in 2002 in a killing that appalled the whole of Britain.

Mr Wells spoke to announce he was taking part in the London Marathon to raise money for bereavement charity Grief Encounter.

The dad talked from the family home in Soham, which is named after his daughter.

He said a turning point had been when he read a handbook by grief counsellors.

Mr Wells said: "It is of course the kind of help we all hope that we'll never need to consider.

"We were in the news a great deal at the time following the loss of Holly and the charity wrote to us and asked whether we could get involved.

"I was genuinely overwhelmed when my wife and I found out a charity like Grief Encounter existed.

"I could have wept tears of joy and relief when I read the Grief Encounter workbook.

"It gave me permission to grieve for Holly for the rest of my life. I'm now proud to help this charity.

"We have met some extraordinary people through Grief Encounter since we became involved."
articles.teaser: KEVIN Wells says the picture of Holly in a Man U shirt 'no longer impacts' on him
articles.headline: This picture of my Holly no longer haunts me
articles.subdeck: Tragic victims ... Holly Wells,left, and Jessica Chapman

image.caption: Arrest ... Danny Care

articles.articlebody:
RUGBY ace Danny Care has been arrested on suspicion of sexual assault.

Cops have been quizzing the England and Harlequins scrum half after a young woman claimed she was groped earlier this month.

The alleged incident is claimed to have occurred in the early hours of May 4, the same night Care was arrested for being drunk and disorderly.

He accepted a police caution after being spotted urinating outside a Leeds hotel.

Care, 25, has been bailed until May on the sex assault charge, pending further inquiries.

This is the fourth time Care has been arrested in just over three months.

In December he paid an £80 fixed penalty after he was arrested for being drunk and disorderly.

And he was fined £3,100 and banned from driving for 16 months after being caught drink-driving on the M3 on New Year's Day.
articles.teaser: SCRUM half is arrested over young woman's claims she was groped earlier this month
articles.headline: Danny Care arrested over sexual assault claims
articles.subdeck: Arrest ... Danny Care

image.caption: Hideously offensive ... Hanks and parent in 'blackface' at fundraiser

articles.articlebody:
MOVIE star Tom Hanks has apologised for sharing a stage with a "blacked-up" man  calling the incident "hideously offensive".

The Forrest Gump actor was filmed taking part in a bizarre sketch during a fundraiser at his kids' posh primary school.

In the clip, Hanks, 56, is seen hosting a charity auction in a room decorated to look like a jungle, an apparent reference to his 2000 flick Castaway.

He is then accosted by a parent with a blackened face, afro wig and animal print costume, carrying a giant stuffed gorilla.

Hanks makes a quip about a right-wing US political commentator, saying: "A celebrity in our midst - who would have thought Bill O'Reilly would join us?"

Eagles rock star Glenn Frey, who was co-hosting the event at St Matthew's Parish School in Pacific Palisades, California, jokes: "This is as close to diversity as we'll get at St Matthew's."

Identified



The man with the blacked-up face has since been identified as investment banker James Montgomery, whose kids also went to the £13,000-a-year school.

Critics are now calling for Hanks, known for his squeaky-clean image, to be dropped from a presidential campaign video for Barack Obama.

The actor told a US website: "In 2004, I was blindsided when one of the parents got up on the stage in a costume that was hideously offensive then and is hideously offensive now.

"What is usually a night of food and drink for a good cause was, regrettably, marred by an appalling few moments."

Niger Innis, spokesman for the right-leaning Congress of Racial Equality, said: "I call upon President Obama, who has Tom Hanks doing the narration to his campaign video, to cease, to remove Mr Hanks's voiceover from his video, and end any association or affiliation with Mr Hanks.

"It is gross, it's coarse, and it is shocking that something like this would be done in California."

The footage was given to US website The Daily Caller by a woman who filmed the event back in 2004.

She called Hanks a hypocrite, adding: "Tom would be the first to scream 'racist' if a conservative put their arm around a Wall Street banker in blackface while their co-MC made racists remarks."
articles.teaser: FORREST Gump actor apologises for sharing stage with man in 'blackface'
articles.headline: Hanks in hot water over sketch with 'blacked-up' man
articles.subdeck: Hideously offensive ... Hanks and parent in 'blackface' at fundraiser

image.caption: Controversial proposals ... George Osborne

article.caption: 1m more will pay 40% tax
Council's tax bills to be frozen next year
He's taking us for fuels
Gran Theft Osbo
Budget 2012 offers crumb of comfort for workers

articles.articlebody:
THE Budget was unfair because it left the rich the biggest winners, according to a YouGov poll for The Sun yesterday.

The first public verdict on the Chancellor's blueprint showed 56 per cent of people believe the wealthiest will pay less tax.

Only 23 per cent thought average earners will see tax bills cut. And just 21 per cent thought "people like themselves" will pay less.

Half of voters said the Budget was not fair, while 32 per cent believed it was.

That is a dramatic change since last year's Budget, when 44 per cent said Mr Osborne's proposals were fair and only 31 per cent branded it unfair.

The poll puts Labour on 42 per cent  eight points ahead of the Tories, with Lib Dems on nine per cent.

Seven out of ten said the Chancellor should have cut fuel duty. Only 19 per cent thought he was right to leave duty unchanged.

There was fury over the "granny tax", with 68 per cent saying it was wrong to freeze pensioners' tax-free allowances.

And 55 per cent opposed the decision to cut the 50p tax rate to 45p for earnings over £150,000. Just 32 per cent backed the move.

But 90 per cent supported increasing the tax-free threshold to £9,205, while 84 per cent agreed with a seven per cent stamp duty on homes above £2million.

Just over half supported letting parents earn up to £60,000 a year before they lose all their child benefit.
articles.byline: By GRAEME WILSON, Deputy Political Editor
articles.teaser: FIRST public verdict on the blueprint showed 56% believe the wealthiest will pay less tax
articles.headline: Sun poll: Richest are the big winners in Budget
articles.subdeck: Controversial proposals ... George Osborne

image.caption: Crackdown ... but No 10 insists the price of a pint in a pub won't be affected by the plans

article.caption: Cameron declares war on cheap booze and cigs
Two-day booze lay-off
No booze and curfews for lags with tags
Last orders, orders  Speaker's clampdown on boozed-up MPs

articles.articlebody:
DAVID Cameron will today declare war on binge drinkers with plans to DOUBLE the price of cheap high-strength booze.

The PM wants every unit of alcohol to be sold for a minimum of 40p.

It means a two litre bottle of nine per cent cider which currently costs around £3 would have to be sold for at least £7.20.

The controversial move comes despite opposition from at least five Cabinet members  including Health Secretary Andrew Lansley and Deputy PM Nick Clegg.

They argue it infringes personal liberties and will only sting the poorest people in society.

Mr Cameron said: "I know this won't be universally popular.

"But binge drinking is a serious problem. The crime and violence it causes drains resources in our hospitals and spreads fear in our communities. We're going to attack it from every angle."

No 10 insisted the price of a pint in a pub and most bottles of wine won't be affected by the action. It comes in the Government's long-promised Alcohol Strategy, which is published today.

The crackdown on bad boozing includes a ban on shops offering jumbo discount deals. Bars will also be given strengthened powers to stop serving drunks.

Police welcomed the minimum unit price  but the British Retail Consortium dubbed it "a tax on responsible drinkers".

The UK's biggest brewer Diageo also blasted it as "misguided".

Director Andrew Cowan said: "There is no credible evidence that it is an effective measure in reducing alcohol-related harm."

t.newtondunn@the-sun.co.uk

Weaker drinks on shelves

By EMMA LITTLE

PUBS and supermarkets are to sell weaker booze in a bid to cut binge drinking in Britain.

Thirty-four producers and suppliers have signed a pact with the government to make and sell lower-strength tipples.

It follows the failure of TV ads to halt bingeing, coupled with increased sales of super-strength wines, beers and lagers.

Health Secretary Andrew Lansley said the "Responsibility Deal"  which hopes to see one billion fewer alcohol units sold by 2015  would result in "thousands" fewer hospital admissions and alcohol-related crimes a year.

Henry Ashworth, of industry body the Portman Group, said: "We are committed to offering a wider choice of drinks with a bit less alcohol."
articles.byline: By TOM NEWTON DUNN, Political Editor
articles.teaser: PM David Cameron wants every unit of alcohol to be sold for a minimum of 40p
articles.headline: PM's 40p a unit war on bingers
articles.subdeck: Crackdown ... but No 10 insists the price of a pint in a pub won't be affected by the plans

image.caption: Victim ... Hollywood beauty Scarlett Johansson

articles.articlebody:
A GEEK accused of getting into email accounts to access and distribute nude photos of celebrities including Scarlett Johansson has agreed to plead guilty to federal charges.

Court documents show that Florida man Christopher Chaney, 35, will confess to accessing The Lost In Translation star's system as well as accounts of Christina Aguilera and Mila Kunis.

On Monday he will admit nine offences, including unauthorised access to a computer, and could face up to 60 years in prison.

He was arrested in October after an investigation by police authorities.

Prosecutors say he got into the email accounts of more than 50 people in the entertainment industry.

Chaney said he managed to access Johansson's email account to send one of her acquaintances an email containing a nude photo of her in exchange for a photo.

His computer hard drive contained numerous private celebrity photos and a document that compiled their extensive personal data.

Chaney forwarded many of the photographs to two gossip websites and another hacker, but there was no evidence he profited from his scheme.

Defence attorney Christopher Chestnut said: "To date, Chris has been very cooperative with prosecutors.

"He's remorseful for any of the harm caused to the stars.

"He just looks to a resolution of the case."
articles.teaser: COMPUTER whizz Christopher Chaney is to admit federal charges in America
articles.headline: Scarlett nude email suspect to plead guilty
articles.subdeck: Victim ... Hollywood beauty Scarlett Johansson

image.caption: Stolen ... crook took laptop twice

articles.articlebody:
A THIEF who visited his victim to say sorry for stealing his computer has been jailed  after nicking his NEW laptop.

Ivan Barker, 21, went to the home of Jean Jacque Mathely in StokeonTrent after the first crime as part of a restorative justice scheme.

But the new laptop proved to be too much for him and he nabbed it when Mr Mathely's back was turned.

Barker has now been jailed for 16 weeks after admitting the offence at Stoke Magistrates Court.

He told JPs he had sold the stolen goods for drink and had only swiped the computer after getting stressed.

Prosecutor Sue Hayers said Mr Mathely had heard a knock at the door when he saw Barker outside.

She said: "The defendant said the police had asked him to visit to apologise for the previous offence.

"He initially believed the apology was genuine and let him in.

"They had a conversation, and the injured party went to the toilet. He then heard the defendant shout that he was leaving.

"When Mr Mathley went back into the living room he noticed the drawer on his computer desk was open and his laptop was missing.

"The defendant had also taken two 100 packs of cigarettes."

Mr Mathely had just bought the computer for £200 to replace the first one stolen three months earlier.

Gary Corbett, mitigating, said: "The defendant had been drinking to excess and taking cocaine before he went to the address.

"This was an opportunistic offence, he didn't go there with the intention to steal these items."
articles.teaser: CROOK Ivan Barker jailed for 16 weeks after taking laptop on restorative justice call
articles.headline: Thief who stole man's computer says sorry then nicks his new one
articles.subdeck: Stolen ... crook took laptop twice

image.caption: Woman in black ... former spy Anna Chapman hits the catwalk

articles.articlebody:
SEXY spy Anna Chapman looks like an angel from double-o-heaven on the catwalk in Moscow.

The ravishing Russian red-head donned a daring studded leather jacket, skin-tight black jeans and stilettos during a show at the Mercedes-Benz fashion show.

Secret agent-turned-sexpot Anna, 30, was sensationally exposed two years ago, along with nine other Russian spies who had been living undercover in America.

After their arrest in June 2010, the group admitted conspiring to serve as unlawful agents of the Russian Federation within the US.

And in a throwback to Cold War-era prisoner exchanges, they then were swapped in Vienna for a handful of Western spies held in Russia.

Anna later swapped her life of secret dossiers and clandestine meetings for the glitz and glamour of a modelling career.
articles.teaser: RAVISHING Russian red-head Chapman struts the catwalk at Moscow fashion show
articles.headline: Sexy spy Anna looks lovely in leather at fashion show
articles.subdeck: Woman in black ... former spy Anna Chapman hits the catwalk

image.caption: Cereal ... baby food

articles.articlebody:
A BABY was left home alone while her vile mum went on a bender  for five days and nights.

She faces jail after cops broke in and found the 16-month-old starving in her cot when neighbours alerted them to the girl's screams.

A court heard her nappy had not been changed for days, there was blood on a blanket, and when police gave the baby water she gulped it down  also grabbing food she was offered.

Her mother, 20, was traced to a friend's house and admitted abandoning her daughter so she could party from dusk till dawn.

But she insisted she had occasionally popped back to her stinking, beer can-strewn house in Brecon, Powys, to feed her daughter on Cheerios and bread. The mother  who pleaded guilty to neglect, cruelty, ill-treatment, abandonment and wilful assault of her baby over five days  wept as she was threatened with jail.

She will be sentenced later after prosecutor Heath Edwards told Merthyr Tydfil Crown Court: "The police got in through an open window and found the house a total mess. The officer saw the child lying in the crib. There was a strong smell of urine. Her clothes were stinking dirty and had not been changed for several days.

"The lounge was strewn with bottles and beer cans. There was clear indication of drug abuse."

The baby was taken back to the police station where nappies were bought from a corner shop.

Judge Richard Twomlow told the mum, who cannot be named, that the baby  now being cared for by relatives  suffered "pain and misery".

j.coles@the-sun.co.uk
articles.teaser: MUM says she occasionally popped back to feed daughter on Cheerios and bread
articles.headline: Mum left baby home as she partied
articles.subdeck: Cereal ... baby food

image.caption: 'I have a walk to make them bounce to show they're real' ... Stephanie Fox has 32K boobs

article.caption: Model with 38KKK boobs is saved by airbags
I was terrified my PIP implants were a ticking timebomb. I just wanted them out
'I'm proud to be UK average size 16. And I'll never yo-yo again'
How to drive Men Mad

articles.articlebody:
STEPHANIE FOX has something she'd like to get off her chest... her back-breaking, all-natural, size 32K boobs are casting a shadow over her life.

The 21-year-old can't get a boyfriend, can't find clothes to fit and can't even walk down the street without getting an earful of abuse.

Men don't look her in the eye. Girls assume she is a porn star. Then there's the back pain.

She says: "Lots of women want big boobs but it's actually a total nightmare.

"The only men I attract are the sleazy type. It's rare that a guy looks me in the face when talking to me.

"Guys will flat-out stare and try all the cheesy chat-up lines. And a lot of the time they want their picture taken with them. Not me  them."

She adds: "Sometimes it can be a bit scary. A few blokes will try to get really hands-on. When I'm out with my male friends they'll usually circle round me. They're my bodyguards."

Stephanie doesn't fare much better with other girls. She says: "Women assume my boobs are fake  they look at me like I'm a porn star. It's older women who always comment on them.

"They'll tut and shake their heads as they walk past me in the street. I can hear them saying, 'They're so fake', and, 'Look at her flaunting them'.

"I try to smile through it. I know they're real but sometimes it can be hurtful.

"I've developed a way of walking so my boobs bounce up and down and people can see they're real. It looks like I'm walking on the moon.

"Women can get quite jealous  that's probably why I have more male friends."

But meeting the right guy is difficult. Glasgow girl Stephanie says: "I broke up with my ex in 2010. He couldn't handle all the attention I get and became insanely jealous.

"When we were out he'd get mad when other guys checked me out. I tried telling him it couldn't be helped  he knew what he was getting into."

Stephanie has seen a few men since the split but no one special has caught her eye.

She says: "They become too obsessed with my boobs, it's all they think about. It's hard to find a guy to see past them.

"A lot of blokes are just after me for the status of it, they see it as just another notch on the bedpost.

"I want my boyfriend to see me for me, I'm more than just a pair of boobs. I'm a laid back and a down-to-earth girl and I love to have a laugh." Stephanie's boobs proved something of an overnight sensation when she was just 12.

She recalls: "It was so weird. I was a total cheeseboard then one day I woke up with a C cup. It was really annoying because I loved PE and sport.

"I was really into hurdles and running but my boobs started to restrict me. And as I got bigger, it was harder to find a sports bra."

During one family holiday in America Stephanie and her mum Josie, 51, went in search of one that would fit.

She recalls: "We tried this lingerie shop to get a measurement. I was 19 and about a 30J at that point.

"The staff couldn't believe it. Instead of measuring me they just kept calling more and more staff members out of the back to stare at them."

Stephanie adds: "Finding a bikini is atrocious. Nothing fits me so I have to buy separates. "I'll buy a size 12 for my lower half and a 20 for my top half  but even that's too small and they'll be spilling out all over the place. I also get serious back pain.

"Exercise is a nightmare. To do any exercise I have to wear a bra then a sports bra on top.

"I'll go to my local gym and I just get stared at. Gym clothes are quite tight so the guys will full-on stare."

Stephanie doesn't know how she got her huge boobs  though there is something in her family genes.

She says: "My mum does have big boobs but she's probably more of a DD or an E. But my sister Morena has normal-sized breasts.

"Whenever I visit her she'll say, 'God, Stephanie, can you give me some of your boobs!'"

She adds: "I think my dad and older brothers found it awkward when I blossomed. They didn't like men checking me out on the beach. We went on holiday to Italy last year. We went to a water park and I was getting a lot of male attention. Wives were whacking their husbands over the head for staring."

Stephanie works in her parents' fancy dress shop, where she is able to stitch her clothes to fit. She says: "If I don't adjust tops they swamp me or I just look huge. So I've become quite the seamstress."

As for the future, Stephanie plans to start her own business and says: "I know it sounds weird but I'd love to run my own corn on the cob stall.

"I saw a stall selling sweetcorn when I was 15 and ever since, that's what I've wanted to do. You can have butter and pepper on it and things like that  it would be pretty cool."

And despite all the aggro she gets over her shape, on balance she wouldn't want to downsize.

She says: "A part of me loves the attention. They're a great talking point and I get to meet a lot of people. But the downsides probably outweigh that one positive.

"And even the attention can be a double-edged sword. Some days I just don't want to be stared at."

myView

By CAROL COOPER, Sun Doctor

ABNORMALLY large breasts can cause a number of problems, mostly due to the sheer weight. They change the way a woman stands, increasing the curvature of the spine and putting extra strain on it.

This makes back and neck pain common. It can be even worse if the woman has to lift anything heavy.

Shoulders can also suffer, with bra straps causing deep grooves from the weight they support. Nerve pain down the arm can occur, sometimes with tingling in the fingers.

Sweating under the breasts is inevitable, so dermatitis and infections are common, with ulceration in bad cases.

Exercise is tricky. Some women wear two bras at once but it is hard to stop breast discomfort.

Adverse comments can make the woman feel very ill at ease and some become stressed and even depressed.

a.jones@the-sun.co.uk
articles.teaser: STEPHANIE'S back-breaking, all-natural boobs are subject of daily abuse from strangers
articles.headline: My natural 32K boobs are a nightmare...only sleazy blokes chat me up while girls tut and assume I'm a porn star
articles.subdeck: 'I have a walk to make them bounce to show they're real' ... Stephanie Fox has 32K boobs

image.caption: Honoured ... Lieutenant Commander Ian Molyneux

articles.articlebody:
A NAVY officer tragically killed trying to stop a sailor on a gun rampage has been honoured beyond the grave.

Lieutenant Commander Ian Molyneux was awarded a posthumous George Medal for trying to tackle Ryan Donovan on his shooting spree.

Lt Cdr Molyneux, 36, a father of four from Standish, Wigan, was shot in the head trying to disarm Donovan after hearing shots on board the HMS Astute submarine on April 8 last year.

Today his widow Gillian said: "On behalf of myself and our children, I wish to express how extremely proud and humbled we all feel to know that Ian's remarkable bravery has been recognised with such a prestigious award.

"Ian is so desperately missed, but his memory will live on through his four beautiful children and in the hearts and minds of all who knew him."

Donovan was jailed for 25 years for murdering Lt Cdr Molyneux and attempting to murder Lieutenant Commander Christopher Hodge, Petty Officer Christopher Brown, and Chief Petty Officer David McCoy.

The killer  a rap fan who dubbed himself Moondog  went berserk on the sub while it was docked in Southampton during a council visit.

Southampton City Council's leader Royston Smith and chief executive Alistair Neill managed to wrestle him to the ground where he was captured.

In a letter to Lt Cdr Molyneux's widow, First Sea Lord Admiral Sir Mark Stanhope said: "In giving his life to save others Ian demonstrated courage of the highest possible order.

"His selfless actions displayed incredible presence of mind and singular bravery."

Mr Smith and Mr Neill are also awarded the George Medal in the Civilian Gallantry List today for their heroic actions in grabbing the gun from Donovan.

Admiral Stanhope added: "Cllr Smith and Mr Neill showed tremendous bravery.

"The Royal Navy as a whole, the ship's company of HMS Astute and their families will always owe a debt of gratitude for their actions in preventing further death or injury on that tragic day."
articles.teaser: MURDERED Ian Molyneux given posthumous award for trying to stop gunman
articles.headline: Sub shooting hero honoured
articles.subdeck: Honoured ... Lieutenant Commander Ian Molyneux

image.caption: Standing proud ... Afghan war hero Corporal Carl Taylor

article.caption: Tragic blast hero had 'heart of a lion'
Lest wheel forget
£100m for hero homes
Now heroes' pensions are under attack
Commanding officer's tribute to 'six of our fallen brothers'

articles.articlebody:
AFGHAN war hero Corporal Carl Taylor beams with pride yesterday after being awarded the prestigious Military Cross.

The dad, of 3rd Battalion the Mercian Regiment, saved three children stranded in the middle of a gun battle in Helmand.

With "complete disregard for his own safety" he ran in front of Taliban fighters to scoop up the boys with the help of a pal.

Cpl Taylor, 25, said: "It wasn't their fault they were stuck in the middle of it.

"They were stuck behind a small wall and they were too scared to move because of the gun fire which was very heavy.

"I just ran out and grabbed one child and ran back to the compound. Then me and my platoon commander dashed out and got one each."

Among the 131 troops celebrated at the Operational Honours List ceremony in London was Michelle Ping  winner of Best Reservist at The Sun's Millies last year.

Air Engineer Mechanic Ping, 27  who sat next to Prince Harry at our awards bash  received a Mention in Despatches for saving a comrade who had been shot in the head on the roof of an Afghan compound.

She said: "To hear my citation being read in front of my peers who I am just in awe of has left me speechless.

"It's been an incredible year, first the Millies then this, I don't know how I'm going to go back to normal after this.

"But I'd back on that roof again tomorrow even if I knew none of this was going to happen.

"We became like a small family out there, I know the lads would have done the same for me."

Also honoured was Chinook pilot Flight Lieutenant Jon Singh, who was awarded a Distinguished Flying Cross.

It was the same gong that was given to his grandad, Flying Officer David Bhore, who flew reconnaissance missions over Burma in World War II.

Flt Lt Singh, 31, from Bristol, distinguished himself when he dropped troops at a Taliban bomb factory amid a hail of enemy fire that hit the steering mechanism and hydraulics, leaving his aircraft virtually "unflyable".

He said: "It took all the strength I had to control the aircraft. It was the single most demanding event of the tour.

"We started receiving fire pretty much as soon as we touched down. I knew we were being hit."

He added: "The controls were jammed and forced back into my stomach. I used both hands to get the aircraft flying.

"The human reaction is utter fear and an overwhelming desire to get out of that situation. It was almost unflyable."

Serjeant Deacon Cutterham, 28, was awarded a Conspicuous Gallantry Cross after his quick action to chuck a grenade out of a ditch saved his life and that of the men around him.

He had just five seconds to react when the explosive was hurled at them into a water-filled ditch in Nahr-e Saraj on May 24 last year.

He grabbed it and lobbed it at a parallel ditch where it exploded immediately.

Serjeant Cutterham, from Bristol, said: "I heard the 'ching' of the flying off lever and it came over the wall, it all happened so slowly, it landed about two or three meters away.

"I knew what it was and I just went into autopilot. I shouted, 'get down, grenade', and I moved in towards it.

"As soon as I let go of it, it exploded, I still can't believe I didn't lose my fingers."

Bomb disposal hero Lieutenant Commander Richard Talbot, 33, received a Queen's Commendation for Bravery after he sat for nearly three hours straddling an unexploded WWII bomb discovered during building work in Plymouth on Remembrance Day 2010.

He successfully made the German DS70 house buster safe and later destroyed it at sea.

Talbot repeated the feat again on February 23 when a second device was found in the same street.

The Commanding Officer of mine hunter HMS Brocklesby, Lieutenant Commander James Byron, was awarded a Distinguished Service Cross for his exploits operating just six miles off the coast of Libya.
articles.teaser: AFGHAN war hero Corporal Carl Taylor beams with pride yesterday after being awarded the prestigious Military Cross
articles.headline: Hero's honour
articles.subdeck: Standing proud ... Afghan war hero Corporal Carl Taylor

image.caption: Sanctions ... British-born Asma

articles.articlebody:
THE SHOPAHOLIC British-born wife of Syrian President Bashar Assad has been slapped with an assets freeze and travel ban.

The move comes after secret e-mails revealed she splashed out tens of thousands of pounds in an online spending spree.

Asma al-Assad has been targeted in the latest round of sanctions by senior European officials who hope to stop the Syrian government's crackdown on members of the opposition.

The mum-of-two, referred to as the "real dictator" was slapped with the ban after 3,000 e-mails written by the country's first couple were leaked by opposition activists.

The former investment banker is among a dozen including her husband who are on the sanctions list.

Asma, 36, from west London, bought luxury goods in London and Paris including jewells, furniture and a Venetian glass vase from Harrods when the uprising was in full swing.

She also used an alias to make purchases across Europe and also asked a friend to acquire a copy of Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2 for her two children. She also purchased candlesticks, clothes and chandeliers.

The former investment banker has been given the ban along with four members of the Assad family including her husband's mum, sister and sister-in-law and eight government ministers.

Her assets in the EU have been frozen and she has been banned from travelling to the European Union but this is unlikely to be enforced as she holds UK citizenship.

The decision came on a day of renewed violence across Syria, with the army firing at least 24 mortar rounds into the city of Homs, in killing up to eight civilians, opposition leaders said.

The UN estimates more than 8,000 people have been killed since the uprising began a year ago.

Foreign Secretary William Hague said it was very important to increase pressure on the Syrian regime. He said: "Their behaviour continues to be murdering and totally unacceptable in the rest of the world."

Sanctions already in place on the country include a ban on arms sales and imports on oil.

Laywer Nigel Kushner, a British lawyer, said he believed Asma Assad is now effectively banned from traveling to the UK.

He said: "No EU national and no EU company can make any funds or any economic resources available to Asma al-Assad, nor can anyone receive funds or economic resources from her.

"And that means that, essentially, she won't be able to go on any shopping trips in the EU or via third parties.

"To the extent she has any bank accounts in the EU, her assets will be frozen."
articles.teaser: SHOPAHOLIC wife of Syrian President Assad slapped with assets freeze after luxury buys
articles.headline: Assad wife in assets freeze
articles.subdeck: Sanctions ... British-born Asma

image.caption: Wheel of fortune ... Hazel Loveday lost out on share of lotto win after quitting syndicate

article.caption: Bus winners: We may help drop-out Hazel
Jackpot anguish
Bus driver's £3.1m 'retirement present'
Newsagent jailed for stealing customer's £156k Lotto ticket
£45m lotto winner Matt Topham rellies get readies

articles.articlebody:
THE skint single mum who lost out on a share of £38million after she quit her fellow bus drivers' EuroMillions syndicate moaned yesterday: "It's been a week from hell."

Struggling Hazel Loveday, 26, said her 12 pals had not been in contact to offer her a slice of the jackpot  and insists she would have helped them had she won on her own.

Hazel left the syndicate because she could not afford the £2 a week. Her place went to another driver six months ago.

She said: "If I won I'd definitely give the lads at the depot a million or more.

"I'd have been in touch with them if it was the other way round. We were like one big happy family in work."

Hazel told how she was in hospital when her colleagues hit the jackpot  after she collapsed at work the day before.

She said: "They all know that I was in hospital because I was in work when I collapsed but they haven't sent a card or any flowers.

"I don't know why they haven't been in touch yet  they must be caught up with their win."

Hazel has yet to hear from any of her jubilant workmates, who all immediately quit their jobs as drivers for bus firm Stagecoach in Corby, Northants.

Several have indicated they will see her all right.

The 12 each scooped £3.1million last Friday.

The day before, Hazel had collapsed at Corby Central bus station with a headache and dizziness.

John Noakes, 49  who was one of the winners  rushed to her side and stayed with her until an ambulance arrived.

She was taken to nearby Kettering General Hospital  and was discharged on Sunday.

The mum was still lying in hospital when a pal told her the drivers had won. She said: "I thought it was a joke. But then I saw it in the paper. I was happy for them. I don't want to dwell on what could have been.

"John really looked after me when I was ill. He stayed by my side and texted me to see if I was OK. It has been a week from hell. I haven't been able to go into work.

"I feel very weak and dizzy and all of this is making it worse."

Hazel, who has a little boy aged four, added: "Obviously I would have loved to win the millions but that isn't what has made me ill."

As the lucky drivers toasted their win earlier this week, Ally Spence, 57, admitted: "She must feel really bad."

Fellow winner Jim Patton, 55, said: "We all like Hazel, she's a good friend." Stephen Derrick, 53, added: "If we do decide to do something about her it will be private."

She said all the drivers had considered jacking in the syndicate last September after their working hours were cut.

It had been running for more than two years and their £1,248 outlay had returned just £212.

Hazel, whose investment had topped £200, pushed for them to switch to the Irish lotto because she heard the odds gave a better chance of winning.

In the end she was the only one to drop out  as the rest decided to soldier on with EuroMillions.

Hazel, who shares a modest two-bed house in Kettering with son Matthew, confessed: "I don't know who took my place.

"I just wish whoever it was all the best  they brought in the good luck."

r.dale@the-sun.co.uk
articles.teaser: THE skint single mum who lost out on a share of £38million after she quit her fellow bus drivers' EuroMillions syndicate moaned yesterday: "It's been a week from hell."
articles.headline: Lotto bus mum: I'd hand them £1million ... they haven't been in touch
articles.subdeck: Wheel of fortune ... Hazel Loveday lost out on share of lotto win after quitting syndicate

image.caption: Prayers ... Fabrice Muamba

article.caption: Fabrice Muamba asks: Did we lose?
Muamba speaks

articles.articlebody:
FABRICE Muamba's family last night thanked the millions of fans wishing for the footballer's recovery, saying: "Our prayers have been answered."

The Bolton ace was in a stable condition in hospital yesterday.

But doctors warned fans to "manage their expectations" of the 23-year-old's recovery following his cardiac arrest in Saturday's FA Cup match at Spurs.

Pals said his parents and fiancée Shauna Magunda, 27, were braced for the worst but were pleased by his good progress so far.

Bobby Barnes, of the Professional Footballers' Association, said: "I've spoken to his mother and father.

"They feel at the moment their prayers have been answered."

JOIN OUR CAMPAIGN FOR CPR IN SCHOOLS BY CLICKING HERE

A family friend added: "They believe the millions of prayers said for Fabrice have helped him pull through."

Yesterday Chelsea stars Daniel Sturridge and Gary Cahill visited Muamba at the London Chest Hospital in Bethnal Green, East London.

Bolton boss Owen Coyle said the Muamba family have given their blessing for the team's home match against Blackburn Rovers to go ahead tomorrow.
articles.teaser: FAMILY of ace  now in a stable condition  say: 'Our prayers have been answered'
articles.headline: Muamba's family thank fans
articles.subdeck: Prayers ... Fabrice Muamba

image.caption: BANKER MANAGER ... Guardiola is in line to be highest-paid boss in world
DESPERATE ... Roman Abramovich

article.caption: Barca get a Pep talk

articles.articlebody:
ROMAN ABRAMOVICH is ready to hand super-coach Pep Guardiola a four-year deal worth £40million AFTER TAX to become Chelsea boss.

The club's billionaire Russian owner refuses to give up on his quest to lure Barcelona's all-conquering manager.

And that includes making Guardiola the highest-paid boss in the world with a money-no-object offer worth £10m a year in cash, according to one Blues insider.

Guardiola's Nou Camp deal is up at the end of the season and Abramovich will not call off the chase while the manager leaves his future up in the air.

He currently earns around £8m a year NET at Barca but Rom can eclipse that with his staggering offer.

Sacked Andre Villas-Boas was paid about £4.5m a year and Chelsea coughed up £13m compensation to his previous club Porto to release him last summer.

When you add AVB's £9m-plus pay-off, it means Abramovich has forked out in excess of £2BILLION since taking over at Stamford Bridge only nine years ago.

If he persuades Guardiola, 41, to become his EIGHTH boss, Abramovich will have spent almost £150m on managers alone in wages, compensations and pay-offs.

The other bosses who have cashed in along with AVB are Claudio Ranieri, Jose Mourinho, Avram Grant, Luis Felipe Scolari, Guus Hiddink and Carlo Ancelotti.

While Chelsea struggle off the pitch for a new manager, Gary Cahill is sounding a battle cry on it.

The England centre-back said: "We will roll our sleeves up and go again because we have huge games coming up in the next week or so."
articles.teaser: ROMAN ABRAMOVICH is ready to make a money-no-object offer to Barca boss
articles.headline: Chelsea's £40m Pep talk
articles.subdeck: BANKER MANAGER ... Guardiola is in line to be highest-paid boss in world

image.caption: FIRING BACK ... Alex Ferguson has hit out at 'desperate' Manchester City

video.caption: MAN UTD boss Alex Ferguson launches attack on 'desperate' rivals City

articles.articlebody:
ALEX FERGUSON has launched an amazing attack on Manchester City and warned them he has "plenty of ammunition" if they want to engage in mind games.

Earlier this week, former City midfielder Patrick Vieira said the decision to bring Paul Scholes out of retirement smacked of desperation.

But United have won nine Premier League games and drawn one with Scholes in the team, suggesting the move has worked.

It certainly has provided Ferguson with the opportunity to hit back in a week when Carlos Tevez has made his controversial return to the City fold.

Fergie snapped: "Desperation? If it's desperation bringing the best midfielder in Britain back for the last 20 years then I think we can accept that.

"I think Vieira was programmed for that. Roberto had a wee dig a couple of weeks back. We're all going to play our hand that way. There will be plenty of ammunition for that.

"If you talk about desperation, they played a player the other night who refused to go on the pitch.

"The manager said he'd never play again and he takes a five-month holiday in Argentina. What is that? Could that come under the description of desperation?"

Ferguson also rejected Vieira's assertion that a further sign of United struggling was their inability to keep hold of Ravel Morrison during the January transfer window and their on-going battle to retain Paul Pogba.

Fergie added: "The point he made about Ravel Morrison and losing our young players  we wanted to sell him let's be clear about that, for obvious reasons.

"But we want Pogba to stay because we think he's going to be a fantastic Manchester United player and hopefully that's the case."

Ferguson confirmed he expects to have a strong squad available to face Fulham on Monday.

Chris Smalling, Phil Jones, Fabio, Tom Cleverley and Paul Pogba all came through a reserve-team outing against Aston Villa last night.

And the Scot said: "Phil Jones and Chris Smalling have been in and out in particular in terms of illness and injuries over the last couple of months.

"Tom Cleverley, Paul Pogba and Fabio all had a game. We took Paul off purely because he will be involved on Monday.

"It puts us in a position where we have quite a strong squad now. We are only waiting on Nani and Michael Owen. We expect both of them to restart training next week."

United may be back in second spot by the time they face the Cottagers, although victory will ensure they regain top spot.

Ferguson added: "Every game is must-win now.

"That is no issue for me. I have been used to that for years. Hopefully we can keep the momentum going."
articles.teaser: MAN UTD boss Alex Ferguson hits back at 'desperate' neighbours City
articles.headline: Fergie: We've plenty of ammo for 'desperate' City
articles.subdeck: FIRING BACK ... Alex Ferguson has hit out at 'desperate' Manchester City

image.caption: HAPPY WITH HIS LOT ... Fulham boss Martin Jol
I'm glad I snubbed United - Jol pleased with decision to turn down No2 role

articles.articlebody:
MARTIN JOL admits he is relieved he turned down the chance to become Alex Ferguson's No2 at Manchester United.

Fergie offered Jol the role while he was in charge of Dutch side RKC Waalwijk eight years ago.

However, that move fell through when United found out Carlos Queiroz wanted to return to Old Trafford after an ill-fated spell in charge of Real Madrid.

But Jol claims he is happy with the way things have panned out for him.

The Fulham manager said: "At that time I met him only to have a conversation with him about everything.

"The chance to become his assistant was what he said afterwards.

"We talked football  they played Real Madrid with the 'big' Ronaldo  so it was nice.

"Later he said about the assistant manager post, but I remember his assistant Carlos Queiroz went to Spain to Real Madrid.

"He was sacked so there was always a possibility for him to take him back and that is what he did.

"I think that was good because I don't think I am the best assistant in the world.

"I have a good relationship with Ferguson. If you look at the stats, he is probably the best manager ever."

After the move to United fell through, Jol went on to manage Tottenham, Hamburg and Ajax before joining the Cottagers.

And he is hoping his Fulham side will help him earn his first victory over United as a manager when the teams collide at Old Trafford on Monday.

The Dutchman has been thwarted in seven previous attempts against Ferguson's side.

But Jol joked he has one moral victory, recollecting the infamous Pedro Mendes 'goal that never was' after Roy Carroll dropped his long-range shot over the line at Old Trafford.

Jol said: "I can remember having a few good games and draws.

"I can remember a game where it was 0-0, but we should have won because Pedro Mendes scored a goal that went over the line so in my mind I have beaten them once."
articles.teaser: MARTIN JOL happy to have turned down the chance to be Alex Ferguson's No2
articles.headline: Jol: I'm glad I snubbed United job
articles.subdeck: HAPPY WITH HIS LOT ... Fulham boss Martin Jol

image.caption: DOMINANT ... Vitali and Wladimir Klitschko rule the heavyweight division
FIGHTING TALK ... Lennox Lewis remains confident in his ability
CHASING VITALI ... former WBA champion David Haye
BEATEN AND BLOODIED ... Lewis defeated Klitschko before retiring

article.caption: Ray: Stop talking and get fighting
Ring legend Ray's double life

articles.articlebody:
LENNOX LEWIS insists the Klitschkos are beatable  but the man capable of ending their dominance is happily retired.

Between them, Vitali and Wladimir Klitschko hold the WBC, WBO, WBA, IBF, IBO and Ring Magazine heavyweight titles.

Despite losing the WBA crown to Wladimir last year, David Haye believes he can redeem himself by returning to the ring and claiming the prestigious WBC strap from Vitali.

But while Lewis fancies his good friend's chances against the older Klitschko sibling, the former undisputed champion believes HE is the only man who could beat them both.

Lewis told SunSport: "People always ask if I'm tempted to go back in the ring and the answer is yeah, of course!

"When you see some of the fights out there, or a champion without a real test, I can't help thinking that I'm still his only competition  but I'm retired."

Before hanging up his gloves, Lewis took on Vitali in what proved to be the last of his 44 professional fights.

The contest was stopped in the sixth round due to a severe cut sustained by Klitschko, who maintains to this day that he was promised a rematch.

Despite the temptation of lacing them up one last time, Lewis has always resisted and is more than content with his lot.

But he does admit it is frustrating to watch the Klitschkos dominate the division he united by holding the WBC, IBF and IBO belts.

And the fact the heavyweight scene will never have one true champion while they remain active is something Lewis would love to change.

Speaking before recording a Virgin Media advert for ITV show Britain's Got Talent, he added: "Can the Klitschkos be beaten? Of course they can.

"I always tell people there's a guy out there who can beat them  and they quickly cotton on that it's me.

"It's funny, boxing passes through different eras and it's through no fault of their own that there happens to be no real competition out there for them.

"But boxing is a sport where it's all about being king of the hill, where people want to see one champion.

"We've got two champions right now, two brothers who won't fight each other, and that kind of devalues the whole heavyweight scene. That's what we're stuck with.

"There's definitely too many titles out there. When somebody says they're the champion, you can't help asking the champion of what?

"Unless you've got two belts, you're not a champion to me. The WBC is still the major title out there, it's the most prestigious."

Lewis believes the last opponent he ever faced is showing some serious signs of slowing up now that he is 40.

He said: "I was saying a while ago that Vitali's looking pretty heavy on his feet and is really relying on his size right now.

"Father Time is definitely knocking on his door."

As for Haye, Lewis claims the Londoner still has a chance of securing the fight he craves.

But he openly admits that Vitali could need Haye more than Haye needs Vitali.

The 46-year-old added: "When you look at the grand scheme of things, who else is out there?

"David wants to redeem himself against the bigger Klitschko, who I believe is the more awkward and difficult one, but maybe he can do better against the guy who doesn't move too well.

"I was surprised that David didn't get a better result against Wladimir, but like he said, he did hurt his toe.

"It's hard to move properly when you hurt your toe but, if it was me, I wouldn't have taken the fight because you have to be in perfect nick when you challenge the best.

"You have to be perfect on that day you step into the ring.

"All through training camp you could have injuries or the flu, but that date for the fight is still there, it's cemented and you have to do everything you can to survive until that day.

"When it comes to colds, belly aches, hurt toes, you have to make sure you don't have any of those."

Despite their close friendship, Lewis is adamant he would never have followed Haye's lead of indulging in pre-fght trash talking.

He said: "I realised that people can do all the talking they want, but it really comes down to what you do in the ring.

"When Mike Tyson fought me in 2002, he had all these tough guys around him  including a guy called Crocodile.

"But it didn't bother me because I knew he couldn't bring them in the ring with him, it was just me and him.

"To shut them up, all I had to do was beat Tyson  and I did just that.

"All I ever had to say to people was, 'OK, say what you like but we'll see what happens in the ring'. I'm like the silent assassin."

Unfortunately for fight fans, the 'silent assassin' is enjoying life at home watching his four children grow up.

But the urge of smashing the stranglehold the Klitschko brothers have on heavyweight boxing will never go away.

Lennox Lewis is appearing in Virgin Media's idents for Britain's Got Talent, from this Saturday on ITV1. Check out www.youtube.com/virginmediatalent on Saturday to see the idents in full.
articles.teaser: LENNOX LEWIS insists heavyweight kings the Klitschkos are beatable
articles.headline: I could topple the Klitschko brothers
articles.subdeck: DOMINANT ... Vitali and Wladimir Klitschko rule the heavyweight division

image.caption: FAVOURITE ... Tottenham manager Harry Redknapp is No1 choice for England role

video.caption: HARRY REDKNAPP says his Tottenham stars don't care if he stays or goes

articles.articlebody:
HARRY REDKNAPP has slammed claims Tottenham's slump in form is connected to him being the favourite to land the England job.

Since Fabio Capello resigned as Three Lions boss on February 8, Spurs have won just one in five Premier League matches.

But asked if the two were linked, boss Redknapp said: "Absolute nonsense.

"That is the biggest load of nonsense I have ever heard in my life.

"The players don't care whether I'm the manager next year.They wouldn't lose any sleep over that. That's football.

"Footballers play the game, they come in every day and train.

"Someone else walks in here tomorrow  the king is dead long live the king!

"They don't worry. They don't think 'Harry is going to England' or 'he is going to go somewhere else'.

"I have been around football all my life and it doesn't happen.

"It never enters my mind. I don't think: 'Oh, what's going to happen to me at the end of the season?'

"Whatever happens to me, happens. I don't lose any sleep over it, whether I'm here, somewhere else or nowhere. That's life."

Redknapp's men went on an 11-match unbeaten run to climb near the summit of the table towards the end of 2011.

But the Londoners seem to have lost the killer instinct and flair that defined their performances during that spell.

However, Redknapp added: "It has not affected our confidence at all, not in any way, shape or form.

"The players don't sit in there and think 'We have to make the Champions League'.

"They want to play well in every game. They will come out and train this morning and be as bright as they could be.

"There are nine games to go, a lot of points to play for and there will be lots of twists and turns between now and the end of the season."
articles.teaser: HARRY REDKNAPP has slammed claims Tottenham's slump in form is connected to him being the favourite for the England job
articles.headline: Redknapp: What a load of nonsense
articles.subdeck: FAVOURITE ... Tottenham manager Harry Redknapp is No1 choice for England role

image.caption: REALISTIC ... Roberto Di Matteo

video.caption: CHELSEA boss Roberto Di Matteo says a loss to Spurs could ruin top four bid

article.caption: Take it for Granted... RDM has little hope
£40m net
Spurs are there for the taking
Latest Chelsea team news

articles.articlebody:
ROBERTO DI MATTEO admits it will be curtains for Chelsea's bid to finish in the top four if they lose to Tottenham tomorrow.

Di Matteo's men are currently five points adrit of fourth-placed Spurs after losing at Manchester City in midweek.

But the interim boss is confident the Blues will make the most of home advantage at Stamford Bridge.

He said: "Obviously, a win would give us a big, big lift.

"If we lose, I think it will be very difficult afterwards.

"Mathematically it is still possible so we will fight until the end but we are looking to have a good game tomorrow."

Since replacing the axed Andre Villas-Boas, Di Matteo has led Chelsea to four victories in five games.

And he insists the pressure of a high-profile London derby will not bother his resurgent troops.

The Italian added: "We're used to these big games. The team is fighting for fourth and for the Champions League next season and we understand that.

"It's a game we play at home and we want to take advantage of our home form and our supporters as well.

"I'm certain that we have the toughest run of fixtures from now until the end of the season compared to the other teams.

"But we're a good team, we have a good squad, an almost fully fit squad as well, so we have all the resources we need to be able to challenge.

"We will try, our home form is very good, we haven't lost a game yet in 2012 and we would like that to continue.

"There's a lot of players who have played many games against Tottenham over the years, they are always tough games and we've had some great derbies, but we have the confidence in the camp."
articles.teaser: ROBERTO DI MATTEO fears defeat to Spurs will end Chelsea's hopes of top-four finish
articles.headline: Losing is not an option for Blues boss Di Matteo
articles.subdeck: REALISTIC ... Roberto Di Matteo

image.caption: CONTENT ... Arsene Wenger will not be overhauling his Arsenal squad

articles.articlebody:
ARSENE WENGER insists he will NOT be making wholesale changes to his Arsenal squad this summer.

The Gunners suffered their worst-ever start to a season but have clawed their way back into third place after winning their last six successive Premier League matches.

However, they are a mammoth 15 points behind leaders Manchester United with nine games remaining.

An £11million deal for German striker Lukas Podolski has already been agreed with Cologne.

But Wenger insists the return of Jack Wilshere and Abou Diaby from injury means he is unlikely to recruit overhaul his team.

The Arsenal boss said: "Quantity-wise we will not do a lot. Quality-wise certainly, and we will take a gamble if we find top, top quality of course.

"The number of the squad is 25. We have many players out on loan and we have not had Jack Wilshere or Abou Diaby for the whole season.

"These players will be back and that means number and quality wise we are strong because we are now in the position we are in without these players."

But Wenger admitted he will do his business in the transfer market early this summer.

He added: "Last year was terrible for us because we finished on August 31 at 11.55pm and we do not want to repeat that."

Wenger also spoke at length on Fabrice Muamba, Bolton's former Arsenal midfielder who is making a remarkable recovery from the cardiac arrest he suffered last Saturday.

Muamba was sold to Birmingham in 2007 after spending two seasons at the Emirates and Wenger insisted the 23-year-old midfielder always possessed a fighting spirit.

He added: "Over the years we have stayed in touch with Fabrice.

"Against us, he was always very keen to prove that we made a mistake in letting him go.

"He was always outstanding against us and I hope he will do that again soon.

"Hopefully one day we will have the joy to see him on the football pitch again.

"It was obvious he was a fighter. Technically he was behind when he arrived here.

"But when you looked at him, you would think 'oh, there is something to work on here' and that was his huge determination and desire.

"I let him go for two reasons. The first one is that he had big players in front of him and it was very difficult to take them out and put Fabrice in at the time.

"And the second reason is that he is so highly motivated that I felt he was ready to play and needed to play.

"There always comes a moment in the career of a player that you play him now or you let him go.

"I let him go for his benefit. He understood that very well."
articles.teaser: ARSENE WENGER says he has no plans to splash the cash on new recruits
articles.headline: Wenger: I won't spend big this summer
articles.subdeck: CONTENT ... Arsene Wenger will not be overhauling his Arsenal squad

image.caption: NOT IMPRESSED ... Kevin Pietersen

article.caption: Amir must focus on rehabilitation
Amir: I was tricked into spot-fixing

articles.articlebody:
KEVIN PIETERSEN has told Mohammad Amir and Co that the 2010 spot-fixing scandal was inexcusable.

The England batsman was playing in the infamous Lord's Test where Amir and fellow fast-bowler Mohammad Asif sent down three no-balls in a plan hatched by Pakistan captain Salman Butt and fixer Mazhar Majeed.

Those events have re-entered the news agenda this week following Amir's first interview, in which claimed he was blackmailed into getting involved.

With the three cricketers involved given lengthy bans from the game in addition to their jail sentences, Pietersen is in no doubt justice has been done.

He said: "I love the game of cricket so much and to play in that fixture, to see what those guys did for a little amount of money, is inexcusable in my words.

"It's tough for me to say as I don't know what happened in that Pakistan dressing room.

"But they've been caught and they should serve their time in a very big way because the game of cricket that we all love was dented.

"A lot of people fell out of love with it because of what a few guys had done. Anybody who gets caught needs to be punished."
articles.teaser: ENGLAND ace has told Pakistan trio that 2010 spot-fixing scandal was inexcusable
articles.headline: KP: What Pakistan trio did was inexcusable
articles.subdeck: NOT IMPRESSED ... Kevin Pietersen

image.caption: FOCUSED ... Samir Nasri is determined to win the title

article.caption: Manchester City team news
Rio: City fans are glory hunters
Nasri: I want United to win next six games
Diego's hand for Tevez

articles.articlebody:
SAMIR NASRI insists Manchester City have already shown they have the bottle to win the title.

Having surrendered top spot to arch-rivals Manchester United after a shock defeat to Swansea, it was claimed City's Premier League challenge would crumble.

But Roberto Mancini's men came from a goal behind against Chelsea to glose the gap at the top to just one point in midweek.

And Nasri, 24, is confident the pressure will be back on United by the time champions host Fulham on Monday.

He said: "After Swansea we could not say anything. We had a really bad game and they played really well.

"But after that we recovered and we talked, and said a few things, that we came here to win titles.

"We said that we need to be focused because the remaining games are Champions League finals and we want to win them.

"Since then we have shown great character."

City have been widely criticised for essentially trying to buy the championship.

But Nasri insists nothing will knock him and his team-mates out of their stride as they chase glory.

He added: "There will always be someone there to criticise.

"Not everyone can like City  there will be some who will say we were weak on Wednesday night when we fell behind before beating Chelsea 2-1.

"But inside the club we believe that we can achieve something together  and that is most important."

City can reclaim pole position with victory at Stoke tomorrow.

Nasri is well aware of what a tough proposition the Potters can be but is confident of victory.

He said: "We have to play our football if we want to beat them.

"If we try to play like them we won't win because they are the best at doing it.

"They put the ball in the air and fight but we have different qualities."
articles.teaser: SAMIR NASRI insists Man City have already shown they have the bottle to win the title
articles.headline: Nasri: City won't bottle it
articles.subdeck: FOCUSED ... Samir Nasri is determined to win the title

image.caption: GOOD EVANS ... Manchester United's Jonny Evans scored his first goal against Wolves

article.caption: Fergie: We've plenty of ammo for 'desperate' City
Nasri: I want United to win next six games
Let me play on
Rio: City fans are glory hunters
Rooney mis-hit breaks lad's wrist

articles.articlebody:
JONNY EVANS has been hailed for his efforts in Manchester United's rise to the top of the Premier League.

The Northern Irish defender has featured more often in central defence for United than any other player this term.

The 24-year-old even managed to score his first goal for the club in their five-goal hammering of Wolves at the weekend.

Phil Jones and Chris Smalling are available for Monday's Premier League encounter with Fulham at Old Trafford.

So Evans is facing renewed pressure for his first-team spot but United boss Alex Ferguson seems certain to stick with him.

Fergie said: "He's playing regularly and I think that helps.

"He is still a young player of course and when they get runs of games it helps with their consistency.

"His partnership with Rio has been very good."

Ferguson believes Rio Ferdinand has been a major influence on Evans this season.

He added: "A lot of it has to do with Rio actually because he's really helped Jonny.

"Jonny's always had terrific ability and it's good to see he's in consistent form."
articles.teaser: JONNY EVANS has been hailed for his efforts in Manchester United's rise to the top of the Premier League
articles.headline: Fergie: Jonny be good
articles.subdeck: GOOD EVANS ... Manchester United's Jonny Evans scored his first goal against Wolves

image.caption: COMEBACK KID ... now Scholes wants to play on
Paul Scholes wants to play on for another year

article.caption: Nasri: I want United to win next six games
Rio: City fans are glory hunters

articles.articlebody:
PAUL SCHOLES is ready to extend his comeback to another season.

The veteran midfielder came out of retirement in January.

And the 37-year-old has had a huge hand in helping Manchester United overhaul neighbours City at the top of the table.

Now Scholes wants to follow fellow old-boy Ryan Giggs, 38, into committing himself to another season.

Scholes has taken part in all bar two of United's 15 games from the moment he came on as a sub in the 3-2 FA Cup win over Manchester City on January 8.

He has started eight of those games scoring twice and won rave reviews. Boss Alex Ferguson said: "His form has been fantastic."

Scholes retired at the end of last season but he quickly missed playing as he helped coach the reserves at Carrington.

SunSport revealed his decision to come back ahead of United's match at City.
articles.teaser: MAN UNITED legend Scholes is ready to extend his comeback to another season
articles.headline: Let me play on
articles.subdeck: COMEBACK KID ... now Scholes wants to play on

image.caption: YOUNG GUN PLAN ... Liverpool's manager Kenny Dalglish

video.caption: LIVERPOOL boss Kenny Dalglish says Reds are still in the hunt for fourth place

article.caption: Latest Liverpool team news
Liverpool Dream Team ratings
QPR 3 Liverpool 2

articles.articlebody:
LIVERPOOL boss Kenny Dalglish is in no hurry to "take the nappies off" the club's crop of young talent.

Jonjo Shelvey, 20, Jon Flanagan, 19, and Jack Robinson, 18, have had limited chances this season having made the step up from the academy in the previous campaign.

Flanagan could come into contention against Wigan tomorrow as Glen Johnson is still out injured, while Martin Kelly was forced off for the second time in two matches after taking a kick at QPR in midweek.

With the club's chances of a top-four finish remote there have been calls for some of the youngsters to be given a chance.

But Dalglish will not throw them in at the deep end for the sake of it.

He said: "There comes a time when you have to take the nappies off them and see if they have got it.

"If we have to do that we will do it but at all times the most important thing for us is to maintain the thought that we are protecting them for our and their benefit.

"People can shout and bawl about young kids doing well and of course they are doing well.

"But they have done well because they have come here and been looked after in the management and guidance they have had.

"Just trust us to guide them through if they are going to get to the next step and if they are good enough to get there."

Dalglish admits certain players would have gone out on loan had the treatment table at the club not been so busy.

He added: "We have to maintain their progress and for some of the younger boys in our squad  Flanagan, Robinson, Shelvey  if we were in a better position with injuries they could have gone out on loan playing somewhere.
