articles.articlebody:
MARK WRIGHT regularly wore his heart on his sleeve on TOWIE  but now he's wearing sex symbol Kelly Brook on his chest.

The reality star was spotted with the glamour girl's curves plastered all over his pecs.

He wore a white T-shirt emblazoned with an image of Kelly in a skimpy swimsuit as he left his Essex home yesterday.

Mark has spoken about having a soft spot for the actress in the past, revealing he's always had a crush on her.

The pair are due to work together on a British gangster movie that also stars Danny Dyer.

Let's hope Mark changes his top before filming starts  or things could get awkward.

article.caption: BGT first look shows no signs of boybands
One's Duch a fan of Britain's Got Talent
David Walliams gives Simon Cowell the willies
Simon Cowell style shocker
Simon Cowell: 'BGT is so cool'

articles.articlebody:
DAVID Walliams has revealed he is constantly asked one question  whether Simon Cowell is gay.

The new Britain's Got Talent judge said family, celeb mates and fans forever quiz him over his new boss's sexuality.

In an appearance with Simon on this weekend's Jonathan Ross Show, the comic said he finds it intriguing that most people seem obsessed by The X Factor supremo's preferences.

He said: "I have never done anything where people are more interested. The main question I get is, 'Is Simon gay?'

"Even my mum was going, 'Yeah he is really nice  is he gay?'"

Teasing Simon, David added: "Well we know the answer to that. With the gay thing, the jury is still out."

In the scenes to be aired on Saturday, the Little Britain funnyman cavorted on the sofa. He even wound up media mogul by touching his leg with his hand.

He also tweeted a picture of himself with Simon as they sat in the green room, with the caption: "Me and my boyfriend".

David told how Simon often blamed HIM for auditions starting late  claiming that he was "busy" gobbling gourmet food.

He said: "We don't tend to start auditions until 4pm. Simon is a bit late and then he goes in front of the audience and says, 'The reason we are starting late today is because David is eating a three-course meal.'

"The audience are booing me because that's his idea of a joke."

Meanwhile, Simon dashed fans' hopes that he will return to The X Factor by insisting he only came back to BGT after a fans' petition.

Due to his commitments to the US version, he said it would be too difficult to join the panel.

He said: "It's impossible. I would like to but at the moment they run at exactly the same time. But I do miss not doing it."

When host Jonathan said his absence was noticed in last year's BGT, Simon quipped: "There was a petition and six million people signed it to get me back."

The pop guru also confessed to proposing to scores of girls. After admitting they had ALL refused, Simon assured the audience he was happy to be single.

  • Hollywood's Danny DeVito, comic Dara O'Briain and singer Labrinth also make an appearance on the ITV1 show on Saturday at 10.20pm.
articles.teaser: EXCLUSIVE: BRITAIN'S Got Talent judge says he is always asked if boss Simon is gay
articles.headline: David Walliams: Fans always ask me if Simon likes men or laydees
articles.subdeck: Bum note ... David Walliams on the Jonathan Ross Show

DAVID WALLIAMS says his stunning wife Lara Stone isn't pleased about his BGT "bromance" with Simon Cowell.

The comic, who wed the supermodel two years ago, said: "Lara is jealous because every time I come back from work I say, 'Oh guess what Simon said today?' and she actually doesn't really like it."

And he joked: "In our wedding photographs I've pasted Simon over her and sometimes when I get into bed at night I say, 'Is it OK if I call you Simon?'

"The first few times she didn't mind, but then she was wearing the mask..."

articles.articlebody:
BBC1 hit show Luther will be made into a feature-length film after the end of the forthcoming third series, show bosses have announced.

Creator Neil Cross told BBC Radio 4's Front Row: "We'll wrap up Luther as a TV show but I think we'll then probably make the leap to the big screen."

The award-winning detective drama will return for a third run of four 60-minute episodes later this year. Neil says it will have a "powerful and moving ending".

He explained: "The final scene of the final episode is great and we wouldn't want to continue. We'll go out big and leave it at that."

Last year actor Idris Elba, who plays DCI John Luther, revealed he was also keen to make a film based on the show.

He said: "I think that's where the ultimate Luther story will unfold  on the big silver screen."

  • LEIGH FRANCIS is in mourning after the death of his faithful sidekick, Gary.

    The British bulldog was a regular on the comedian's show Celebrity Juice and he even had his own Facebook and Twitter page.

    Leigh, who fronts the ITV2 show as his comic creation Keith Lemon, paid tribute to the mutt before playing a video of his best moments.

    A source said: "Gary was so popular with the fans. Keith broke the sad news during filming on Wednesday that Gary had gone to the 'dog kennel in the sky'.

    "Everyone was gutted to hear the news as he had many fans."

image.caption: Who's that girl ... Jenna-Louise Coleman

article.caption: Jenna-Louise Coleman is the new pal for Dr Who
Karen Gillan's the Dr Ooh girl
Who's snogging Karen Gillan?
Dr Who and pals get exterminated
Matt Smith is Time Lord of the Fries

articles.articlebody:
NEW Doctor Who sidekick Jenna-Louise Coleman has revealed that she has been a nervous wreck trying to keep her new job under wraps.

The former Emmerdale actress was forbidden from talking about sci-fi's biggest secret until her role was officially announced yesterday.

She admitted: "I am so relieved it is out. My flatmates had no idea and it has kind of opened this whole web of lies.

"I have realised that I am actually quite a good liar, which is terrifying actually. I'm beyond excited  I want to get started already."

Speculation about who would take over as the Time Lord's assistant has been rife since Karen Gillan  who has played Amy Pond for the past two series  announced her departure in December.

She will leave in the fifth episode of the series, which is due to screen on BBC1 in the autumn.

But fans will have to wait until the show's Christmas special for the introduction of the new character.

The 25 year old  who played Emmerdale lesbian Jasmine Thomas until 2009  won the role after wowing bosses with her screen test and her chemistry with Time Lord Matt Smith.

But show boss Steven Moffat has so far refused to reveal the name of the character that she will play. He said: "Who she's playing, how the Doctor meets her and even where he finds her are all part of one of the biggest mysteries the Time Lord has ever encountered. Even by the Doctor's standards, this isn't your usual boy meet girl."

Of Amy Pond's exit, he said: "It will be a final encounter with the angels and not everybody gets out alive  and I really mean it this time."

Jenna-Louise  a long-time fan of the show  admitted that former Time Lord David Tennant and his sidekick Billie Piper were her favourite pairing.

But she described her new co-star Matt Smith as "amazing" and "very supportive".

And Moffat said Jenna-Louise  who also stars in ITV1's Titanic series which starts on Sunday  was the only person he has met who can keep up with Matt's pace.

He also revealed: "There was a moment I remember when they were auditioning together and they both looked frightened doing a Doctor Who scene.

"It was an instant poster and I thought, 'God that's brilliant'."

Jenna-Louise found out that she had landed the job while in a Marks & Spencer store buying food.

She said: "I was debating what goes best in a salmon salad and I got a call from my agent.

"I thought, 'I can't carry on shopping now.' So I put down my basket and left.

"I couldn't tell anyone so I went for a bit of a walk and tried to digest it. It's all been quite surreal."

Moffat also confirmed that as well as this year's six episodes, a further eight will be broadcast next year to mark the show's 50th anniversary.

The first episode aired in November 1963 with William Hartnell in the title role.



Who gets two kids



DAVID Tennant claims he is a "double dad", after adopting his wife's ten-year-old son.

The former Doctor Who actor said he made the decision to adopt his actress wife Georgia Moffett's son Tyler last year, shortly after the birth of the couple's daughter, Olive.

He said: "My baby is almost a year old and I adopted my wife's boy last year as well, so I became a father twice in six months. That's got to be something of a record, hasn't it?"

David met Georgia when she guest-starred in an episode of Doctor Who in 2008, playing his daughter.

And after falling in love, the pair married on New Year's Eve in 2011.

Their daughter Olive was born in March last year and it was shortly afterwards that David officially adopted Tyler and they all became one big happy family.

Georgia  the daughter of former Time Lord Peter Davison and American actress Sandra Dickinson  gave birth to Tyler in 2002, aged just 17.

She brought him up alone and has never publicly revealed the identity of her son's father.

articles.headline: Jenna-Louise's sci-fi of relief

articles.articlebody:
MARYAM D'ABO is set to appear in a new spine-chilling telly thriller.

The former Bond girl, who starred in The Living Daylights with Timothy Dalton as 007, will join Geraldine James, Luke Treadaway and Gemma Jones in Thirteen Steps Down.

The two-part drama is based on Ruth Rendell's best-selling novel. Repairman Mix Cellini (Treadaway) believes he's haunted by notorious serial killer John Christie.

And his obsession with a top model, while lodging with eccentric landlady (James), spirals dangerously out of control.

Filming on the ITV drama begins later this month.

articles.articlebody:
LEANDRO Penna gets touchy-feely with newly-divorced Katie Price as they watch a polo match.

There was plenty of horseplay between the pair as they took in the action at the HPA Gaucho International Polo event.

Leandro, 26, couldn't keep his hands off the former glamour model, touching her leg and putting his arm around her neck.

And he landed a smacker on her cheek and shy smiled in response.

But Katie, 33, seemed more interested in the horsemanship on the pitch, taking pictures as Leandro larked around.

Both wore matching white outfits for the event at London's O2, and the Argentinian must have felt right at home  it was sponsored by the steakhouse chain from his home country.

The Latin lover had plenty to celebrate, as Katie's divorce from Alex Reid was granted just 48 hours before.

She split from the cage-fighter in January 2011, less than a year after they wed in Vegas.

And she met male model Leandro at Elton John's Oscar party a month later.

The polo tournament was a perfect night out for Katie, who loves nothing more than horses and a bit of Argentinian beef.

She quite likes a steak too.

video.caption: CORONER says singer accidentally drowned after using cocaine

article.caption: Whitney Houston 'planned to remarry Bobby Brown'
Bobbi: I still talk to mum
Whitney Houston 'died of drug and booze cocktail'
Whitney Houston buried... Bobby Brown hits casino
'Whitney family fears Brown is after her millions'
First image of bath tub where Whitney died

articles.articlebody:
WHITNEY Houston's death was triggered by cocaine, a coroner's report revealed last night.

An autopsy on the singer, 48, found the cause of death was drowning due to heart disease and cocaine use.

The Los Angeles coroner revealed the superstar singer, 48, took a line "immediately" before she drowned in a Beverly Hills hotel bathtub last month.

Toxicology results indicated "chronic use" of cocaine over time had contributed to the heart disease. It is believed the Bodyguard star suffered a heart attack before slipping under the water and drowning.

Relatives were said to be devastated at hearing cocaine was to blame.

Whitney's family said in a statement: "We are saddened to learn of the toxicology results, although we are glad to now have closure."

Her mum Cissy, 79, and daughter Bobbi Kristina, 19, have been struggling to cope since the tragedy.

Coroner's spokesman Craig Harvey confirmed Whitney appeared to have used cocaine "in the time period immediately prior to her collapse in the bathtub".

A report from the coroner's office stated: "How injury occurred: Found submerged in a bathtub filled with water; cocaine intake."

It said Whitney also had marijuana, Benadryl, Xanax and other medication in her system, but those drugs were NOT a factor.

Investigators had said they found no evidence of illegal drugs at the scene, although officials confirmed prescription pill bottles were found.

American showbiz site TMZ reported sources that claimed a mystery individual removed any traces of cocaine from Whitney's hotel room.

They also alleged that the person who cleaned up the drugs had supplied them to the singer.

It added that Beverly Hills Police have confirmed their investigation into Whitney's death had not yet been finished.

But the site said cops would not comment on whether they were looking at any allegations of evidence tampering

The coroner's report said her death was an accident, and added: "No trauma or foul play is suspected."

The coroner's office said results indicated Whitney also suffered from heart disease that caused 60 per cent narrowing of her arteries.

Assistant Chief Coroner Ed Winter said the condition is common in cocaine users.

He said: "It just beats up their heart and they will have a heart attack."

A final, more detailed, coroner's report will be released in two weeks.

Whitney battled addiction to crack cocaine at the height of her fame. Some blamed her stormy 14-year marriage to Bobby Brown.

p.samson@the-sun.co.uk
articles.teaser: STAR died of accidental drowning due to the effects of cocaine use and heart disease, coroner says
articles.headline: Coroner: Cocaine killed Whitney
articles.subdeck: Tragic ... Whitney Houston on night out just two days before her death

image.caption: Lemon ... Osborne's bandit grab is slammed

article.caption: 'Worthless' Game Group on brink of collapse
Terry butcher
Children's growth is stunted

articles.articlebody:
TREASURY officials were yesterday branded LIARS by bookies furious over a new tax that threatens to cost the industry £100million.

As the City reacted to the Budget, WILLIAM HILL chief exec Ralph Topping blasted the Government for "speaking with a forked tongue".

He told Sun City the Treasury had insisted last month that a planned shake-up would be "neutral" for the industry.

But the Chancellor's new 20 per cent tax on gross profits from gaming machines, including fixed-odds terminals, one armed bandits and fruit machines, will clobber them.

Mr Topping said: "They said it was going to be neutral.

"Neutral? It's like Iran saying they're neutral about Israel. They can say it, but you don't believe it. If you were to ask me, 'Do you think they speak with a forked tongue?', I would say 'Yes'."

He added: "One of the Treasury people sat down in front of myself, Richard Glynn at Ladbrokes and Andy Hornby of Gala six to eight weeks ago and said it would be neutral.

"Instead they've dumped £100million on us. I mean  just tell us the truth!" The new Machine Games Duty replaces a flat licence fee that varied by machine, plus VAT  the equivalent of between 15.5 and 17 per cent.

Pub chiefs last night said the move would add £1,000 to landlords' annual costs.

The amusement arcade industry warned that dozens of traditional seaside sites could close. Derek Petrie, of the British Amusement Catering Trade Association, said: "It's inconceivable that a Government supposedly committed to small business and to tourism has made this decision."

Treasury officials last night insisted the Machine Games Duty WAS "revenue neutral"  as smaller operators would pay less.

Machines that don't offer a cash prize  like soft toy grabs  are exempt.

They added that it was a fairer, more "sustainable" form of taxation.

£350m drugs site boost to Britain

GLAXOSMITHKLINE is opening its first UK manufacturing site for almost 40 years in a huge boost to the Chancellor.

The drugs giant yesterday announced a £350million plan to build the new biopharmaceutical factory in Ulverston, Cumbria  creating 500 jobs. The final investment decision was taken last week. Chief exec Sir Andrew Witty said another factory could come in two years.

He stressed the Government's new "Patent Box" legislation, giving pharma companies tax breaks on income derived here, was a "real shift". Sir Andrew added: "At 10am six teenagers rode up on their bikes and asked to put their names down for jobs at the new factory  it was brilliant. It's up to companies now  we have to get on with it."

The firm is also investing more than £100million at two sites in Scotland.

Rocketing rates a King's ransom

THE boss of B&Q owner KINGFISHER yesterday warned sky-high business rates would hammer the high street.

Ian Cheshire welcomed lower corporation tax  but said the 5.6 per cent increase in rates the Chancellor is pushing through this April were a bigger concern.

He said: "I pay £120million in rates and only £54million in corporation tax. Rates are a bigger issue. The Budget was OK but it doesn't change the real world."

Kingfisher's annual profits have leapt 20 per cent to £807million on sales of £10.8billion. Since Mr Cheshire launched a four-year plan in 2008, Kingfisher's market value has more than doubled.

He said the next challenge was to convince more Brits to do DIY. More training classes will be run in stores and equipment made easier to use.

BP strikes it rich with tax break

SUPER-rich oil giant BP may have landed a Budget TAX BREAK, it emerged last night.

Government officials said the firm, one of the wealthiest in Britain, could benefit from a £3billion tax incentive aimed at encouraging oil exploration off the Shetland islands.

The scheme gives oil companies tax relief on the first production of oil from large deepwater fields they discover.

Yesterday BP got the go-ahead to start drilling at North Uist, 77 miles north west of Shetland.

It will be BP's deepest new well in UK waters since the Gulf of Mexico leak in 2010.

The company made £15BILLION in profits last year. A spokesman said: "BP welcomes the Treasury's announcements designed to stimulate investment in the North Sea industry."

New jobs at Lloyds

BAILED-out bank LLOYDS  which axed 30,000 staff in the credit crunch  yesterday announced it is HIRING.

Five hundred are being taken on to bolster the 632 Verde branches it aims to sell to the CO-OP. Recruits will be employed in Gloucester, Birmingham, Sunderland, Swansea and Livingston in Scotland.

The move comes as Lloyds retains the option to float Verde on the stock market if the sale falls through. One analyst billed it as "a warning shot to the Co-op", adding: "It doesn't feel like a done deal."

Optimism is the Next big thing

FASHION giant NEXT yesterday insisted Brits would feel better this year despite the gloom.

Chief exec Simon Wolfson said price inflation in Next clothes had "evaporated"  and the squeeze on customers' earnings was easing. He told Sun City: "That pressure is coming to an end."

Profits increased by 5 per cent to £570.3million last year as the Next Directory catalogue and web business continues to grow.

- PORCELAIN specialist PORTMEIRION has "never been busier" as it churns out commemorative china plates for the Queen's Diamond Jubilee.

Profits rose 20 per cent to £6.3million last year.
articles.teaser: Bookies blast Chancellor George Osborne's £100m machine game Budget raid
articles.headline: Thousands face axe at Game
articles.subdeck: Lemon ... Osborne's bandit grab is slammed

image.caption: Not a rubbish job ... Meg the litter-picking dog

article.caption: Thatcher the bark bencher
You're having a giraffe!
Talking dog Della cries like a baby
Pooch is pitch paw-fect, almost

articles.articlebody:
THIS pooch is no mucky pup  in fact she likes nothing better than CLEARING UP other people's mess.

Border Collie Meg loves to pick up drink cans and sweet wrappers dropped on the floor by litterbugs at her local park.

And she wows walkers in Sudbury, Suffolk, by running hundreds of yards to put the rubbish into bins.

The six-year-old rescue dog is so keen to clean that council workers arriving for their early morning shifts at Sudbury Park often find the park totally clear of litter.

Proud owner Ken Pople, 69, said other dog walkers were left open-mouthed when they saw Meg in action.

The retired taxi driver said: "She just loves doing it and is able to put the litter into all sorts of different bins.

"There are times when we are out and she will drop her ball and run off to put a can in the bin  it's a sight to see.

"When people get up and see a nice clean playing field on a Sunday morning  unbeknown to them Meg has been putting rubbish in the bin."

And the thoughtful mutt has even been helping local litterbugs see the error of their ways.

Ken said: "We were out on the meadows once and there was a group of young lads and girls, and one of them had lobbed a can into the grass.

"Meg went along and picked it up and took it over to the nearest bin and dropped it in.

"The boy's reaction was to say 'That was awesome', so I was able to say 'Perhaps that has taught you a lesson  if she can do it, perhaps you can too'.

"I saw them later and they picked up all their rubbish into a carrier bag and the lad gave me a thumbs up sign as he put it all in the bin.

"I think sometimes a dog can have a better impact at teaching people than I could have done, as they would have undoubtedly taken offence had I told them off."

Andy Nunny, a community warden for Sudbury and Great Cornard, hopes humans will follow the pooch's lead.

He said: "If a dog can be trained to put rubbish in the bin, then surely people can learn to as well."
articles.teaser: BORDER Collie Meg likes nothing more than picking up drink cans and sweet papers before dropping them in bin
articles.headline: Tidy dog has bin well trained
articles.subdeck: Not a rubbish job ... Meg the litter-picking dog

image.caption: Arrest ... Danny Care

articles.articlebody:
RUGBY ace Danny Care has been arrested on suspicion of sexual assault.

Cops have been quizzing the England and Harlequins scrum half after a young woman claimed she was groped earlier this month.

The alleged incident is claimed to have occurred in the early hours of May 4, the same night Care was arrested for being drunk and disorderly.

He accepted a police caution after being spotted urinating outside a Leeds hotel.

Care, 25, has been bailed until May on the sex assault charge, pending further inquiries.

This is the fourth time Care has been arrested in just over three months.

In December he paid an £80 fixed penalty after he was arrested for being drunk and disorderly.

And he was fined £3,100 and banned from driving for 16 months after being caught drink-driving on the M3 on New Year's Day.
articles.teaser: SCRUM half is arrested over young woman's claims she was groped earlier this month
articles.headline: Danny Care arrested over sexual assault claims
articles.subdeck: Arrest ... Danny Care

image.caption: Sanctions ... British-born Asma

articles.articlebody:
THE SHOPAHOLIC British-born wife of Syrian President Bashar Assad has been slapped with an assets freeze and travel ban.

The move comes after secret e-mails revealed she splashed out tens of thousands of pounds in an online spending spree.

Asma al-Assad has been targeted in the latest round of sanctions by senior European officials who hope to stop the Syrian government's crackdown on members of the opposition.

The mum-of-two, referred to as the "real dictator" was slapped with the ban after 3,000 e-mails written by the country's first couple were leaked by opposition activists.

The former investment banker is among a dozen including her husband who are on the sanctions list.

Asma, 36, from west London, bought luxury goods in London and Paris including jewells, furniture and a Venetian glass vase from Harrods when the uprising was in full swing.

She also used an alias to make purchases across Europe and also asked a friend to acquire a copy of Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows Part 2 for her two children. She also purchased candlesticks, clothes and chandeliers.

The former investment banker has been given the ban along with four members of the Assad family including her husband's mum, sister and sister-in-law and eight government ministers.

Her assets in the EU have been frozen and she has been banned from travelling to the European Union but this is unlikely to be enforced as she holds UK citizenship.

The decision came on a day of renewed violence across Syria, with the army firing at least 24 mortar rounds into the city of Homs, in killing up to eight civilians, opposition leaders said.

The UN estimates more than 8,000 people have been killed since the uprising began a year ago.

Foreign Secretary William Hague said it was very important to increase pressure on the Syrian regime. He said: "Their behaviour continues to be murdering and totally unacceptable in the rest of the world."

Sanctions already in place on the country include a ban on arms sales and imports on oil.

Laywer Nigel Kushner, a British lawyer, said he believed Asma Assad is now effectively banned from traveling to the UK.

He said: "No EU national and no EU company can make any funds or any economic resources available to Asma al-Assad, nor can anyone receive funds or economic resources from her.

"And that means that, essentially, she won't be able to go on any shopping trips in the EU or via third parties.

"To the extent she has any bank accounts in the EU, her assets will be frozen."
articles.teaser: SHOPAHOLIC wife of Syrian President Assad slapped with assets freeze after luxury buys
articles.headline: Assad wife in assets freeze
articles.subdeck: Sanctions ... British-born Asma

image.caption: Night-vision view ... the allotments can now be seen clearly in the dark

articles.articlebody:
RURAL cops have been kitted out with night-vision goggles in a crackdown against VEGGIE thieves.

Frustrated growers have seen their prize produce pilfered in a spate of raids on two allotments in Wiltshire.

Police have pledged to root out the crooks and have stepped up patrols and surveillance on the plots.

And the parish council has splashed out £350 on a pair of hi-tech binoculars so they can operate in the dark.

The tactics recall those used by Wallace and Gromit in the Oscar-winning flick Curse of the Were-Rabbit.

It sees the animated duo come to the rescue of residents who begin losing their giant vegetables in mysterious circumstances before the annual growing competition.

Paul Russell, clerk of Stratton St Margaret Parish Council in Wiltshire, said: "We've had quite a few complaints about theft and wanton vandalism of vegetables.

"Many of our allotment holders grow big vegetables to show so they are pretty devastated when their crops get damaged.

"Gardeners who have worked for six or seven months on their pumpkins and onions for show were finding they had been attacked or stolen in the night.

"We thought about putting up fences around the main two allotments but that was likely to cost around £20,000.

"So we thought we would get the night vision goggles instead. We're hoping it will tackle the cause of the vandalism and stop others from doing it."

Two allotments in the parish - White Hart and St Phillips - have been targeted with potatoes, leeks, carrots, onions and pumpkins stolen or left strewn around.

Retired teacher Kate Goldup, 64, and husband Dave, 66, were devastated when their pumpkin crop was smashed to pieces at the St Phillips allotment last year.

Kate said: "It was a week before harvesting and the pumpkins were about the size of a large beach ball. We turned up and found they had been totally destroyed.

"The remnants of them were strewn about nearby. We were growing them with our grandchildren who are five and three so it was really disappointing."

Anne Chalk, who owns a patch at the St Phillips allotment with husband Frank, said: "We know people who have had their produce stolen and trashed.

"It puts you off wanting to plant things because you wonder whether it will still be there when it begins to grow and get big.

"The time and effort you spend planting seeds is all wasted."

Sheds at the allotments have also been broken into, with lawnmowers and other electrical garden equipment taken.

The parish council has bought a pair of £350 Yukon Ranger Pro night vision goggles which emit a single built-in illuminator beam allowing the wearer to see in the dark.

They can be head-mounted and cops are now patrolling with them - although they have yet to catch a crook in the act.

More pairs will be bought if the scheme is a success and local beat bobby PC Frank Key said: "We have thought outside the box with these night vision goggles - now there is nowhere to hide for thieves.

"Darkness is no longer the criminal's friend and it allows police to take back ownership of the night.

"The headgear admits a powerful beam of light, almost invisible to the human eye, which allows me to see in the dark at the touch of a button.

"We have reacted because of reports of stolen and damaged produce  as well as sheds broken into and equipment taken.

"If local criminals know we've got this extra vision capability at night, they will think twice about committing crime."
articles.teaser: RURAL cops kitted out with high-tech gear in crackdown against veg crooks
articles.headline: High-tech night vision goggles to root out parsnip pinchers
articles.subdeck: Night-vision view ... the allotments can now be seen clearly in the dark

image.caption: Hideously offensive ... Hanks and parent in 'blackface' at fundraiser

articles.articlebody:
MOVIE star Tom Hanks has apologised for sharing a stage with a "blacked-up" man  calling the incident "hideously offensive".

The Forrest Gump actor was filmed taking part in a bizarre sketch during a fundraiser at his kids' posh primary school.

In the clip, Hanks, 56, is seen hosting a charity auction in a room decorated to look like a jungle, an apparent reference to his 2000 flick Castaway.

He is then accosted by a parent with a blackened face, afro wig and animal print costume, carrying a giant stuffed gorilla.

Hanks makes a quip about a right-wing US political commentator, saying: "A celebrity in our midst - who would have thought Bill O'Reilly would join us?"

Eagles rock star Glenn Frey, who was co-hosting the event at St Matthew's Parish School in Pacific Palisades, California, jokes: "This is as close to diversity as we'll get at St Matthew's."

Identified



The man with the blacked-up face has since been identified as investment banker James Montgomery, whose kids also went to the £13,000-a-year school.

Critics are now calling for Hanks, known for his squeaky-clean image, to be dropped from a presidential campaign video for Barack Obama.

The actor told a US website: "In 2004, I was blindsided when one of the parents got up on the stage in a costume that was hideously offensive then and is hideously offensive now.

"What is usually a night of food and drink for a good cause was, regrettably, marred by an appalling few moments."

Niger Innis, spokesman for the right-leaning Congress of Racial Equality, said: "I call upon President Obama, who has Tom Hanks doing the narration to his campaign video, to cease, to remove Mr Hanks's voiceover from his video, and end any association or affiliation with Mr Hanks.

"It is gross, it's coarse, and it is shocking that something like this would be done in California."

The footage was given to US website The Daily Caller by a woman who filmed the event back in 2004.

She called Hanks a hypocrite, adding: "Tom would be the first to scream 'racist' if a conservative put their arm around a Wall Street banker in blackface while their co-MC made racists remarks."
articles.teaser: FORREST Gump actor apologises for sharing stage with man in 'blackface'
articles.headline: Hanks in hot water over sketch with 'blacked-up' man
articles.subdeck: Hideously offensive ... Hanks and parent in 'blackface' at fundraiser

image.caption: Tragic victims ... Holly Wells,left, and Jessica Chapman
This picture of my Holly no longer haunts me - Dad of murdered Soham schoolgirl: I imagine her grown up

articles.articlebody:
MURDERED Soham schoolgirl Holly Wells' dad says the picture of her in her football shirt "no longer impacts" on him because he now imagines her as a grown woman.

The image was taken hours before she and Jessica Chapman were killed by Ian Huntley and was used in appeals for the pair's whereabouts.

It shows Holly and Jessica smiling happily in Manchester United shirts at a family barbeque.

In a rare interview Holly's dad Kevin said he now imagined his daughter as a grown woman.

Mr Wells, 48, said: "She would have been 21 this year. She was 10 when she was killed, but she would have been 11 a few weeks later.

"That photo no longer impacts on me. We released it to the police during the 13-day search, because it was a very up-to-date one, the last photo of the girls.

"I don't want to talk about what it has been like the past 10 years, not now."

Holly and Jessica were murdered by Huntley in 2002 in a killing that appalled the whole of Britain.

Mr Wells spoke to announce he was taking part in the London Marathon to raise money for bereavement charity Grief Encounter.

The dad talked from the family home in Soham, which is named after his daughter.

He said a turning point had been when he read a handbook by grief counsellors.

Mr Wells said: "It is of course the kind of help we all hope that we'll never need to consider.

"We were in the news a great deal at the time following the loss of Holly and the charity wrote to us and asked whether we could get involved.

"I was genuinely overwhelmed when my wife and I found out a charity like Grief Encounter existed.

"I could have wept tears of joy and relief when I read the Grief Encounter workbook.

"It gave me permission to grieve for Holly for the rest of my life. I'm now proud to help this charity.

"We have met some extraordinary people through Grief Encounter since we became involved."
articles.teaser: KEVIN Wells says the picture of Holly in a Man U shirt 'no longer impacts' on him
articles.headline: This picture of my Holly no longer haunts me
articles.subdeck: Tragic victims ... Holly Wells,left, and Jessica Chapman

image.caption: Lucky escape ... Glen Folkard shows off his war wound from shark attack

articles.articlebody:
A SURFER is lucky to be alive after a shark took a huge bite out of his leg.

Tattoo artist Glen Folkard was out beyond the breakers when a three-metre bull shark lunged for his board, knocking him into the water and dragging him beneath the surface locked in its powerful jaws.

But as the monster released him for another bite, the 44-year-old Australian seized his chance  and scrambled back on to his board to ride a wave back to Redhead Beach, north of Sydney.

Meanwhile the menacing dark shadow stalked behind, following the blood stream gushing from his horrific thigh wound.

The dad-of-one said: "It was everything you'd think it would be, just sheer terror.

"He's hit me from underneath, he's grabbed me, he's turned me, took me under and then let go because I think he had fibreglass in his mouth... and that was my chance."

Glen collapsed in the sand after pulling himself up on to the beach.

He added: "I just remember rolling off the surfboard on to my back, looking at the sky and just loving life instantly.

"I was laying on my back looking just at the blue sky, going 'I'm alive, I made it' because it was all but over. He was metres away from having a second go."

Glen lost more than FOUR POUNDS of flesh from his leg and nearly bled to death.

He spent several days in intensive care fighting for his life after suffering horrific blood loss.

But despite his savage leg wounds, Glen says he does not hold a grudge against the shark that bit him.

He said: "He didn't know any better, it was a mistaken identity."

A witness, named only as Peter, said the attack scene was like something out of thriller film Jaws.

He said at the time: "My son actually said he saw the shark leap out of the water and grab a fish before the attack.

"It was kind of like the scene at the start of Jaws where everybody's pulled out of the water and it's a hot day and the water's inviting."

Surfer Steve Tidey was also nearby when the shark attacked Glen in January.

He said: "There was a disturbance in the water and I looked back and saw him get back on the board.

"There were bits of his board floating in the water and blood was streaming out from behind him.

"I knew there had been a shark attack."

As paramedics rushed to the scene, lifesavers gave Glen oxygen before he was carried to a nearby shed for treatment.

This was the first shark attack at a netted beach in New South Wales, Australia, since February 2009 when a surfer lost his hand at Bondi.

But it is not known, whether the net at Redhead Beach where Glen was attacked had been removed by maritime authorities.

The New South Wales government's shark net programme includes more than 50 beaches over a 200 mile part of the coast north and south of Sydney.

But the region's Green Party has called for the removal of all shark nets, because they are ineffective and pose a hazard to marine life.
articles.teaser: DAD amazingly surfed to safety after beast ripped four pounds of flesh from his thigh
articles.headline: Shark attack surfer saved his own life by riding wave to safety
articles.subdeck: Lucky escape ... Glen Folkard shows off his war wound from shark attack

image.caption: Filth ... pig found in council home

article.caption: About that 'micro pig' you sold me...
Micro pigs celebrate Xmas in sty-le

articles.articlebody:
A MAN has been evicted from his home after literally letting it become a PIG STY.

The council house in Derby was left to rack and ruin - with a Gloucester Old Spot pig found roaming free inside.

Carpets throughout the ground level of the two-up two-down home were soiled with faeces and muck - including the kitchen and toilet.

The unnamed owner - believed to be an "excessive hoarder" - was also keeping two Shetland ponies in the garden and a dog living alongside the pig in filthy conditions.

Fed up residents made a number of complaints after reporting they thought the pig had been kept cooped up inside for over a year.

While others reported a strong smell of urine whenever the weather was warm.

One resident living on Kingsley Street said: "He used to chuck stuff outside in the middle of the night and once I saw laminate flooring soaked in poo and urine piled up outside the home."

Another noted: "I saw the man with the pig when it was tiny and he just had it in his hands outside the front of his home.

"I thought it was one of those micro-pigs which wouldn't grow - but obviously it wasn't and he just kept it cooped up in there for over a year."

Derby Homes, which manages the council house, said the "excessive hoarder" had filled rooms with so much junk that they could not get in at all.

Maria Murphy, director of housing and customer service, said it would cost between £10,000 and £15,000 to clear the damaged home.

She added: "This is a disgraceful waste of money, caused by a tenant who failed to show respect for this property or his tenancy agreement."

Derby Homes had been trying to get access to the property since September last year when the first complaint was made of a pony being kept in the rear garden and a pig being inside.

Although RSPCA and housing staff went out, the tenant would not allow them access.

And after the RSPCA paid him a surprise visit two months later they spotted two ponies in the garden.

A court order then told the tenant to allow access to housing staff but he failed to comply.

The court, therefore, granted an eviction notice and staff swooped on March 15.

Mrs Murphy said the tenant arrived at his home as staff were gaining entry and took away the dog and pig.
articles.teaser: A MAN has been evicted from his home after literally letting it become a PIG STY.
articles.headline: Snout nice about this house - it's a pig sty
articles.subdeck: Filth ... pig found in council home

image.caption: Woman in black ... former spy Anna Chapman hits the catwalk

articles.articlebody:
SEXY spy Anna Chapman looks like an angel from double-o-heaven on the catwalk in Moscow.

The ravishing Russian red-head donned a daring studded leather jacket, skin-tight black jeans and stilettos during a show at the Mercedes-Benz fashion show.

Secret agent-turned-sexpot Anna, 30, was sensationally exposed two years ago, along with nine other Russian spies who had been living undercover in America.

After their arrest in June 2010, the group admitted conspiring to serve as unlawful agents of the Russian Federation within the US.

And in a throwback to Cold War-era prisoner exchanges, they then were swapped in Vienna for a handful of Western spies held in Russia.

Anna later swapped her life of secret dossiers and clandestine meetings for the glitz and glamour of a modelling career.
articles.teaser: RAVISHING Russian red-head Chapman struts the catwalk at Moscow fashion show
articles.headline: Sexy spy Anna looks lovely in leather at fashion show
articles.subdeck: Woman in black ... former spy Anna Chapman hits the catwalk

image.caption: A ride bargain ... turtle rollercoaster

articles.articlebody:
A TURTLE rollercoaster from Michael Jackson's Neverland ranch is set to sell for at least £32,000.

The five carriage kids' ride was especially made for Jacko because he wanted something which worked inside and outside his house.

But he was forced to flog it a year before he passed away in June 2009 in a bid to ease his financial difficulties.

A spokesman for online celebrity auction house Gotta Have Rock and Roll said: "We usually don't get items of this type because, as you imagine, such items are rarely up for sale.

"We are thinking a museum or an amusement park or even a mega Michael Jackson collector.

"It is valued at $50,000 (£32,000), but we think in the heat of the bidding it could possibly go for a lot more.

"We are happy to ship it anywhere in the world, the postage should be pretty pricey."

The green-coloured ride measures 160ft long and can carry ten thrillseekers at a time.

The bidding ends online on March 30.
articles.teaser: JACKO flogged kids' ride year before he passed away to ease financial problems
articles.headline: Jacko's Neverland ride to sell for £32k on web
articles.subdeck: A ride bargain ... turtle rollercoaster

image.caption: Creepy ... the Thistledown Velvet Ant

articles.articlebody:
LOOKS like this insect is having a bad hair day.

The tiny Thistledown Velvet ant is just two centimetres long. But thanks to its vicious sting it is known as Cow Killer Ant.

Despite its name it is a wingless female wasp. It is found crawling through lawns or digging around soil.

Snapper Robert Jensen, 58, captured this super close-up photo while travelling through the Mojave Desert in California.

His 22-year-old son Chris spotted the critter wandering around on the ground.

The male of the bug species are even smaller  though it does not mean their sting is any less painful.

Better buzz off when these insects are around...
articles.teaser: TINY Thistledown Velvet Ant is only 2cms long but is known as a 'Cow Killer' and bites
articles.headline: 'Cow killer' bug's hair is a white old mess
articles.subdeck: Creepy ... the Thistledown Velvet Ant

image.caption: Honoured ... Lieutenant Commander Ian Molyneux

articles.articlebody:
A NAVY officer tragically killed trying to stop a sailor on a gun rampage has been honoured beyond the grave.

Lieutenant Commander Ian Molyneux was awarded a posthumous George Medal for trying to tackle Ryan Donovan on his shooting spree.

Lt Cdr Molyneux, 36, a father of four from Standish, Wigan, was shot in the head trying to disarm Donovan after hearing shots on board the HMS Astute submarine on April 8 last year.

Today his widow Gillian said: "On behalf of myself and our children, I wish to express how extremely proud and humbled we all feel to know that Ian's remarkable bravery has been recognised with such a prestigious award.

"Ian is so desperately missed, but his memory will live on through his four beautiful children and in the hearts and minds of all who knew him."

Donovan was jailed for 25 years for murdering Lt Cdr Molyneux and attempting to murder Lieutenant Commander Christopher Hodge, Petty Officer Christopher Brown, and Chief Petty Officer David McCoy.

The killer  a rap fan who dubbed himself Moondog  went berserk on the sub while it was docked in Southampton during a council visit.

Southampton City Council's leader Royston Smith and chief executive Alistair Neill managed to wrestle him to the ground where he was captured.

In a letter to Lt Cdr Molyneux's widow, First Sea Lord Admiral Sir Mark Stanhope said: "In giving his life to save others Ian demonstrated courage of the highest possible order.

"His selfless actions displayed incredible presence of mind and singular bravery."

Mr Smith and Mr Neill are also awarded the George Medal in the Civilian Gallantry List today for their heroic actions in grabbing the gun from Donovan.

Admiral Stanhope added: "Cllr Smith and Mr Neill showed tremendous bravery.

"The Royal Navy as a whole, the ship's company of HMS Astute and their families will always owe a debt of gratitude for their actions in preventing further death or injury on that tragic day."
articles.teaser: MURDERED Ian Molyneux given posthumous award for trying to stop gunman
articles.headline: Sub shooting hero honoured
articles.subdeck: Honoured ... Lieutenant Commander Ian Molyneux

image.caption: Branching out ... panda cubs try their new tree-climbing skills

articles.articlebody:
IT looks like PANDA-MONIUM as these four cute cubs all try to climb the SAME tree.

The cuddly critters were caught on camera by wildlife photographer Dafna Ben Nun at the world's biggest breeding centre in Sichuan, China.

Dafna was volunteering at the centre where cubs and adult bears are being kept in a desperate bid to save the endangered animals.

The young pandas are kept together to promote play and development and Dafna was with that group when she noticed some of the animals start their climb.

Dafna, 31, from Israel, said despite being very cute, pandas are not the smartest of animals.

She said: "I saw the cubs start to climb the tree, first one, then two, then three and finally four, it looked like the tree was going to fall over.

"The pandas at the centre are so well looked after, the adults each have a large enclosure and the cubs are kept together. In fact the adults enclosures are cleaner than the rooms we stayed in."

Dafna spent ten days at the Wolong Giant Panda Nature Reserve and left having fallen in love with the black and white bears.

She said: "They are the cutest animals and very funny to watch.

"Actually all the pandas in the world are owned by China, even the ones born abroad can be called back at any time."
articles.teaser: FOUR cute panda cubs branch out with new skills - climbing one tiny tree together in Sichuan, China
articles.headline: Panda-monium
articles.subdeck: Branching out ... panda cubs try their new tree-climbing skills

image.caption: Stolen ... crook took laptop twice

articles.articlebody:
A THIEF who visited his victim to say sorry for stealing his computer has been jailed  after nicking his NEW laptop.

Ivan Barker, 21, went to the home of Jean Jacque Mathely in StokeonTrent after the first crime as part of a restorative justice scheme.

But the new laptop proved to be too much for him and he nabbed it when Mr Mathely's back was turned.

Barker has now been jailed for 16 weeks after admitting the offence at Stoke Magistrates Court.

He told JPs he had sold the stolen goods for drink and had only swiped the computer after getting stressed.

Prosecutor Sue Hayers said Mr Mathely had heard a knock at the door when he saw Barker outside.

She said: "The defendant said the police had asked him to visit to apologise for the previous offence.

"He initially believed the apology was genuine and let him in.

"They had a conversation, and the injured party went to the toilet. He then heard the defendant shout that he was leaving.

"When Mr Mathley went back into the living room he noticed the drawer on his computer desk was open and his laptop was missing.

"The defendant had also taken two 100 packs of cigarettes."

Mr Mathely had just bought the computer for £200 to replace the first one stolen three months earlier.

Gary Corbett, mitigating, said: "The defendant had been drinking to excess and taking cocaine before he went to the address.

"This was an opportunistic offence, he didn't go there with the intention to steal these items."
articles.teaser: CROOK Ivan Barker jailed for 16 weeks after taking laptop on restorative justice call
articles.headline: Thief who stole man's computer says sorry then nicks his new one
articles.subdeck: Stolen ... crook took laptop twice

image.caption: 'Traumatised' ... Bales

articles.articlebody:
THE American soldier accused of massacring Afghan villagers will today be charged with 17 counts of murder, it was reported last night.

Sources said US Army staff sergeant Robert Bales will also face trial on six counts of attempted murder, six of assault and violations of military law including dereliction of duty.

Bales, 38, is alleged to have gone berserk after seeing a comrade badly wounded  shooting dead nine children and eight adults as they slept.

He is being held in the US Army's only top-security prison at Fort Leavenworth, Kansas.

His lawyer has claimed he was traumatised by too many combat tours.

Meanwhile a sheriff's report released yesterday said Bales drunkenly put a woman's hand in his crotch and beat up her boyfriend in his home state Washington in 2008.

No charges were brought.
articles.teaser: SGT accused of massacring Afghan villagers to be charged with 17 counts of murder
articles.headline: Sgt on 17 rampage murder charges
articles.subdeck: 'Traumatised' ... Bales

image.caption: Victim ... Hollywood beauty Scarlett Johansson

articles.articlebody:
A GEEK accused of getting into email accounts to access and distribute nude photos of celebrities including Scarlett Johansson has agreed to plead guilty to federal charges.

Court documents show that Florida man Christopher Chaney, 35, will confess to accessing The Lost In Translation star's system as well as accounts of Christina Aguilera and Mila Kunis.

On Monday he will admit nine offences, including unauthorised access to a computer, and could face up to 60 years in prison.

He was arrested in October after an investigation by police authorities.

Prosecutors say he got into the email accounts of more than 50 people in the entertainment industry.

Chaney said he managed to access Johansson's email account to send one of her acquaintances an email containing a nude photo of her in exchange for a photo.

His computer hard drive contained numerous private celebrity photos and a document that compiled their extensive personal data.

Chaney forwarded many of the photographs to two gossip websites and another hacker, but there was no evidence he profited from his scheme.

Defence attorney Christopher Chestnut said: "To date, Chris has been very cooperative with prosecutors.

"He's remorseful for any of the harm caused to the stars.

"He just looks to a resolution of the case."
articles.teaser: COMPUTER whizz Christopher Chaney is to admit federal charges in America
articles.headline: Scarlett nude email suspect to plead guilty
articles.subdeck: Victim ... Hollywood beauty Scarlett Johansson

image.caption: No piece of cake ... some restaurants are charging customers for bringing birthday cakes

article.caption: Spring bake  our pick of the best getaways
Good enough to eat

articles.articlebody:
YOU can have your cake and eat it  but it will cost you!

A host of celebrity-owned eateries are leaving punters choking on their dessert by CHARGING to carry a birthday cake to their table  even if it's one you brought along yourself.

The "cakeage" fee  coined from the corkage diners pay for bringing their own wine  can be as high as £25 per person, so can really add up to leave a sour taste in the mouth.

Here Lee Price and Emily Fairbairn expose some of the culprits and show what they slap on your tab.

THE GRAPES - Sir Ian McKellen (£3 'cakeage' per person)

THE Lord Of The Rings actor McKellen, who plays elderly wizard Gandalf in the fantasy film trilogy, co-owns gastro-pub The Grapes.

This listed 18th Century building in Limehouse, east London, may look ye olde with its period features. But with a flat-rate cakeage levy of £15 for parties of two to five, then £3 a head for bigger groups, there's nothing traditional about the bill.

MAZE GRILL - Gordon Ramsay (£5 'cakeage' per person)

CELEBRITY chef Ramsay is as famous for his effing and blinding as his nosh.

But customers may well be letting fly a few tasty expletives of their own if they take a birthday cake along to his grillhouse in London's posh Mayfair.

Talk about Hell's Kitchen!

RHODES 24 - Gary Rhodes (£9.45 'cakeage' per person)

RHODES may not be getting as many TV gigs as Jamie Oliver  but at least he's raking it in on cakeage.

His Michelin-starred diner on the 24th floor of one of London's tallest buildings, Tower 42, offers diners views across the City.

The gaff is not all that's sky-high, though.

NOBU - Robert de Niro (£5 'cakeage' per person)

ANOTHER posh Mayfair eaterie, this one is co-owned by Taxi Driver movie legend Robert De Niro.

There are also outlets in Los Angeles, Hong Kong and Dubai.

But some punters won't be able to afford a taxi home after coughing up for their bill.

THE FAT DUCK - Heston Blumenthal (up to £25 'cakeage' per person!)

FAMED as one of Britain's finest dining experiences, with three Michelin stars, Blumenthal's pride and joy is pretty pricey  a set menu is £180 per head.

So perhaps no surprise that The Fat Duck, in Bray, Berks, is worst offender in our cakeage hall of shame.

A flat rate of £50 for two to four people, rising to £70 if there are five or six, seems totally quackers.

Elsewhere



THE charges above may seem incredible but at least you can bring your own cake.

At celebrity eaterie The Ivy, where the likes of X Factor boss Simon Cowell often eats, they point-blank refuse to let you in with a cake, citing health and safety.

But High Street favourites such as Pizza Express and Cafe Rouge have no such objection  staff laughed when we asked if they levied for cakeage. And not all celebrity restaurant owners will sting you so cruelly on your birthday.

Marco Pierre White's steakhouse in Chester does not  and staff will even lay on balloons and sing for you if you take in a cake.
articles.byline: By LEE PRICE and EMILY FAIRBAIRN
articles.teaser: YOU can have your cake and eat it  but it will cost you!
articles.headline: Slice little earner
articles.subdeck: No piece of cake ... some restaurants are charging customers for bringing birthday cakes

image.caption: Smash ... David Doherty, 27

articles.articlebody:
THE son of My Big Fat Gypsy Wedding hardman Paddy Doherty was last night charged with killing a pal in a car smash.

David Doherty, 27, will appear in court today accused of causing death by dangerous driving.

He was taken to hospital after a 4x4 he was believed to have been driving collided with a van in Bangor, North Wales.

Dad-of-five James Loveridge, 35, died and three other men were injured.

A relative said after the funeral of Doherty's fellow gypsy yesterday: "Everyone who knew him is devastated."

Ex-prize fighter Paddy, 53, who last year won Celebrity Big Brother, recently moved his family from Gtr Manchester to a caravan site in Queensferry, North Wales.

His eldest son Patrick died in a car crash when he was 18.
articles.teaser: DAVID Doherty accused of causing death by dangerous driving after gypsy pal dies
articles.headline: Gypsy star's son faces death rap
articles.subdeck: Smash ... David Doherty, 27
